title: book audit list

communications.subject: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: book audit list
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

Public reports show that this school district has been subject to book and curriculum challenges: 

https://www.tnonline.com/20240814/lasd-member-wants-book-audit/ 

https://buckscountybeacon.com/2024/09/moms-for-liberty-lehighton-area-school-district-board-member-wants-to-restrict-access-to-lgbtq-books/ 

Therefore, I request the following: 

1) All instructional materials, presentations and presentation materials (including recorded video and audio, PowerPoint files, prepared remarks, and slides formats), and other guidance related to “audit list”, “book audit” and “committee”; “parental consent”, “opt-in”, "follett", "destiny", “fox rothschild”, “solicitor”, or “ellen hopkins”. This includes A) any notes taken during meetings that book and curriculum challenges B) any other document that has been used to help explain book and curriculum challenges, including internal documentation, public relations materials, and executive summaries.

2) Any digital communications (including but not limited to emails and text messages) as well as documents, (including but not limited to PDF, word processing, excel, and slide documents) about, pertaining to, or mentioning “sexually explicit”, “gone girl”, “innocence”, "follett", "destiny", “white privilege”, “transgender”, “moms for liberty”, “m4l”, “jack corby”, “sean gleaves”, “pulled books”, “ellen hopkins”, “beyond magenta”, “side by side: having a gay or lesbian sibling”, or “grooming”. 

3) Any emails, presentations, videos, memos, recordings, or other records mentioning “sexually explicit”, “innocence”, “white privilege”, “transgender”, "follett", "destiny", “moms for liberty”, “m4l”, “jack corby”, “sean gleaves”, “pulled books”, or “grooming”. 

Please perform this search for records between July 1, 2024 and the time this request is processed. This request is not for commercial purposes and will be used in the course of reporting for 404 Media, an independent, journalist-owned news site (www.404media.co).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Claire Woodcock

communications.subject: Lehighton Area School District
communications.communication:
Good afternoon,

We are in receipt of the Right-to-Know request requesting materials and
documents regarding book auditing, etc. We will be happy to provide you all
of the materials requested to the best of our abilities with only the
necessary redactions that may be required under FERPA and
HIPPA regulations. However, as this is a bit of a major undertaking, we
will need the 30-day extension provided by Pennsylvania law.
-- 
Sincerely,

Jason Moser
Superintendent of Schools
Lehighton Area School District

title: Israel Bonds

communications.subject: New Hampshire Right to Know Law Request: Israel Bonds
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Hampshire Right to Know Law, I hereby request the following records:

Email communications, between October 1st, 2023 and the current date, between personnel at the Office of the Treasurer and anyone from the following organizations:
•	Development Corporation for Israel - @IsraelBonds.com
•	JLens - @JlensNetwork.org
•	Anti-Defamation League - @ADL.org
•	Government of Israel - @gov.il
•	Embassy of Israel Washington - @Washington.mfa.gov.il
•	Consulate General of Israel Boston - @Boston.mfa.gov.il
Please note, that this is not a keyword search. Instead could you please search based on the email domains listed above? We ask for this time frame to to the popularization of Israel bonds following October 2023.

I understand that some information may be exempt under current law; please provide all non-exempt portions of the documents. The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Noam Perry

title: Patel appointment

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Patel appointment
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Introductory announcement, prepared remarks, agenda items, and other materials related to the appointment of Ricky J. Patel as special agent in charge of the New York Area of Responsibility.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Felipe De La Hoz

communications.subject: ICE FOIA 2025-ICFO-53236
communications.communication:
08/07/2025 
Felipe De  La Hoz 
MuckRock News DEPT MR 190634 
Boston, Massachusetts 02115 
RE:        ICE FOIA Case Number 2025-ICFO-53236 
Dear Requester: 
This acknowledges receipt of your 8/5/2025, Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE), for Introductory announcement, prepared remarks, agenda items, and other materials related to the appointment of Ricky J. Patel as special agent in charge of the New York Area of Responsibility. 

Your request was received in this office on 8/5/2025. 

After careful review of your FOIA request, we determined that your request is not reasonably described due to the reason(s) listed below: 

-Your request is too broad in scop, please narrow. 
-Your request did not specifically identify the records which you are seeking. 
Records must be described in reasonably sufficient detail to enable government employees who are familiar with the subject area to locate records without placing an unreasonable burden upon the agency.  For this reason, §5.3(b) of the DHS regulations, 6 C.F.R. Part 5, require that you describe the records you are seeking with as much information as possible to ensure that our search can locate them with a reasonable amount of effort.  Whenever possible, a request should include specific information about each record sought, such as the date, title or name, author, recipients, case number, and subject matter of the records, if known, or the ICE program office you believe created and/or controls the record. The FOIA does not require an agency to create new records, answer questions posed by requesters, or attempt to interpret a request that does not identify specific records. 

-Clearly identify the subject matter. 
-Provide a date range of X-X days/weeks/months/years. 
-Identify the specific program office, position titles, or individuals. 
-Avoid using general or ambiguous language (e.g. “all communications,” “everything related to,” “all records”). 

If you require assistance to reasonably describe the records you are seeking, please contact FOIA Public Liaison Daniel Edgington at (866) 633-1182 or 500 12th St., SW Stop 5009 Washington, DC 20536-5009. You have a right to seek dispute resolution services from the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) which mediates disputes between FOIA requesters and Federal agencies as a non-exclusive alternative to litigation.  If you are requesting access to your own records (which is considered a Privacy Act request), you should know that OGIS does not have the authority to handle requests made under the Privacy Act of 1974.  You may contact OGIS as follows:  Office of Government Information Services, National Archives and Records Administration, 8601 Adelphi Road-OGIS, College Park, Maryland 20740-6001, e-mail at ogis@nara.gov; telephone at 202-741-5770; toll free at 1-877-684-6448. 

 

Sincerely, 
ICE FOIA Office 
Immigration and Customs Enforcement 
Freedom of Information Act Office 
500 12th Street, S.W., Stop 5009 
Washington, D.C. 20536-5009

communications.subject: ICE FOIA 2025-ICFO-53236
communications.communication:
08/21/2025 

Felipe De  La Hoz 
MuckRock News DEPT MR 190634 
Boston, Massachusetts 02115 

RE:	ICE FOIA Case Number 2025-ICFO-53236 
 
Dear Requester: 

This acknowledges receipt of your 8/5/2025, Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE), for Introductory announcement, prepared remarks, agenda items, and other materials related to the appointment of Ricky J. Patel as special agent in charge of the New York Area of Responsibility 

.  Your request was received in this office on 8/5/2025. 

Due to the increasing number of FOIA requests received by this office, we may encounter some delay in processing your request. Per Section 5.5(a) of the DHS FOIA regulations, 6 C.F.R. Part 5, ICE processes FOIA requests according to their order of receipt. Although ICE’s goal is to respond within 20 business days of receipt of your request, the FOIA does permit a 10-day extension of this time period. As your request seeks numerous documents that will necessitate a thorough and wide-ranging search, ICE will invoke a 10-day extension for your request, as allowed by Title 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(B). If you’re able to narrow the scope of your request please contact our office. Narrowing the scope may speed up the search process. We will make every effort to comply with your request in a timely manner. 

Provisions of the FOIA allow us to recover part of the cost of complying with your request.  We shall charge you for records in accordance with the DHS Interim FOIA regulations, as they apply to media requesters.  As a media requester, you will be charged 10 cents per page for duplication; the first 100 pages are free.  We will construe the submission of your request as an agreement to pay up to $25.00. You will be contacted before any further fees are accrued. 

We have queried the appropriate program offices within ICE for responsive records. If any responsive records are located, they will be reviewed for determination of releasability. Please be assured that one of the processors in our office will respond to your request as expeditiously as possible. We appreciate your patience as we proceed with your request. 

If you have any questions, please contact FOIA Public Liaison, Daniel Edgington at 500 12th Street, SW, Washington DC 20536 or (866) 633-1182. Additionally, you have a right to seek dispute resolution services from the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) which mediates disputes between FOIA requesters and Federal agencies as a non-exclusive alternative to litigation.  If you are requesting access to your own records (which is considered a Privacy Act request), you should know that OGIS does not have the authority to handle requests made under the Privacy Act of 1974.  You may contact OGIS as follows:  Office of Government Information Services, National Archives and Records Administration, 8601 Adelphi Road-OGIS, College Park, Maryland 20740-6001, e-mail at ogis@nara.gov; telephone at 202-741-5770; toll free at 1-877-684-6448. 

Your request has been assigned reference number 2025-ICFO-53236. Please use this number in future correspondence. 

Sincerely, 

ICE FOIA Office 
Immigration and Customs Enforcement 
Freedom of Information Act Office 
500 12th Street, S.W., Stop 5009 
Washington, D.C. 20536-5009

communications.subject: ICE FOIA Case Number 2025-ICFO-53236
communications.communication:
Felipe De  La Hoz 
MuckRock News DEPT MR 190634 
Boston, Massachusetts 02115 

RE:	ICE FOIA Case Number 2025-ICFO-53236 
 
Dear Requester: 

This letter is the final response to your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE), dated 8/5/2025.  You have requested Introductory announcement, prepared remarks, agenda items, and other materials related to the appointment of Ricky J. Patel as special agent in charge of the New York Area of Responsibility 

ICE has considered your request under both the FOIA, 5 U.S.C. § 552, and the Privacy Act, 5 U.S.C. § 552a.  Information about an individual that is maintained in a Privacy Act system of records may be accessed by that individual unless the agency has exempted the system of records from the access provisions of the Privacy Act. 

ICE has conducted a search of the ICE for records responsive to your request and no records responsive to your request were found. HSI 

For your information, Congress excluded three discrete categories of law enforcement and national security records from the requirements of the FOIA.  See 5 U.S.C. § 552(c) (2006 & Supp. IV (2010).  This response is limited to those records that are subject to the requirements of the FOIA.  This is a standard notification that is given to all our requesters and should not be taken as an indication that excluded records do, or do not, exist. 

While an adequate search was conducted, you have the right to appeal this determination that no records exist within the above mentioned ICE office(s).  Should you wish to do so, you must send your appeal and a copy of the original response letter, within 90 days of the date of the letter following the procedures outlined in the DHS FOIA regulations at 6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.8.  You may submit your appeal electronically at GILDFOIAAppeals@ice.dhs.gov or via regular mail to: 

U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement 
Office of the Principal Legal Advisor 
U.S. Department of Homeland Security 
500 12th Street, S.W., Mail Stop 5900 
Washington, D.C. 20536-5900 

Your envelope and letter should be marked “FOIA Appeal.”  Copies of the FOIA and DHS regulations are available at www.dhs.gov/foia. 

Provisions of FOIA allow DHS to charge for processing fees, up to $25, unless you seek a waiver of fees.  In this instance, because the cost is below the $25 minimum, there is no charge. 

If you have any questions please contact FOIA Public Liaison Daniel Edgington at (866) 633-1182 or 500 12th St., SW Stop 5009 Washington, DC 20536-5009 and refer to your tracking number. Additionally, you have a right to right to seek dispute resolution services from the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) which mediates disputes between FOIA requesters and Federal agencies as a non-exclusive alternative to litigation.  If you are requesting access to your own records (which is considered a Privacy Act request), you should know that OGIS does not have the authority to handle requests made under the Privacy Act of 1974.  You may contact OGIS as follows:  Office of Government Information Services, National Archives and Records Administration, 8601 Adelphi Road-OGIS, College Park, Maryland 20740-6001, e-mail at ogis@nara.gov; telephone at 202-741-5770; toll free at 1-877-684-6448. 

Sincerely, 

Megan Davis 
Deputy FOIA Officer, Operations

title: Family Member Care Tax Credit Statistics

communications.subject: North Dakota Open Records Law Request: Family Member Care Tax Credit Statistics
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the North Dakota Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Information related to the Family Member Care Tax Credit from as far back as data systems will allow through 2025. Specifically, the following information, as it is available:

1) Number of returns that claimed the credit
2) Total amount of credits claimed ($)
3) If available, (1) and (2) separately by taxpayer characteristics, such as filing status, marital status, age of taxpayer, AGI range, number of dependents, etc.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Gabrielle Pepin

communications.subject: Record Request Family Member Care Tax Credit
communications.communication:
Ms. Pepin,

We are in receipt of your record request dated January 24, 2026, which we received today. We are in the process of reviewing your request and will reach out soon.

If you have any questions regarding this request, please feel free to contact me.

Sincerely,

Matthew Danielson
Special Assistant Attorney General
NORTH DAKOTA OFFICE OF STATE TAX COMMISSIONER
600 E Boulevard Ave., Dept. 127
Bismarck, ND 58505-0599
P: 701-328-2781  |  Fax: 701-328-3700  |  nd.gov/tax<http://www.nd.gov/tax>

[cid:image001.png@01DC950E.C0615FC0]

files.title: image001
files.source: Office Of State Tax Commissioner, North Dakota

communications.subject: Family Member Care Tax Credit North Dakota
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Pepin:

Although you framed your request as an open records request, what you seem to be seeking is for us to collect statistical data. You requested information regarding the Family Member Care Tax Credit including:


  1.  Number of returns that claimed the credit
  2.  Total amount of credits claimed ($)
  3.  If available, (1) and (2) separately by taxpayer characteristics, such as filing status, marital status, age of taxpayer, AGI range, number of dependents, etc.

Because the purpose of an open records request is to obtain copies of records that already exist, our response to your request as an open records request would be that we have no documents responsive to your request.

However, we were able to collect the data you were seeking. Attached to this email is an Excel document with the information we were able to pull from our system. The credit information is stated by year, amount, and number of claimants, and contains two tables sorting the information by federal AGI and filing status. Please note that the earliest available information is from tax year 2000, and that these totals reflect the actual credit amount claimed on individual income tax returns based on the unique circumstances of each return.

Based on changes in tax law in 2023, which generally eliminated the payment obligation for the lowest bracket of individual income tax (approximately Federal taxable income of $50,000 and below), there are no credit amounts to report for the period of 2023 through present.

If I can be of any further assistance with regard to this request, please reach out to me at mfdanielson@nd.gov<mailto:mfdanielson@nd.gov>.

Sincerely,



Matthew Danielson
Special Assistant Attorney General
NORTH DAKOTA OFFICE OF STATE TAX COMMISSIONER
600 E Boulevard Ave., Dept. 127
Bismarck, ND 58505-0599
P: 701-328-2781  |  Fax: 701-328-3700  |  nd.gov/tax<http://www.nd.gov/tax>

title: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Brazoria County Sheriff's Office)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Brazoria County Sheriff's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2025. If possible, please provide this data in database or spreadsheet format and include the case number, incident date, incident time, subject injured indicator, subject injury force related info (e.g. Yes or No), subject age, subject gender, subject ethnicity, subject weapon type, incident area occurred, force type, officer division (e.g. law enforcement operations, detention/correctional operations, etc.), badge number and names associated with the officers involved. If one or more of these fields or dates is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If no database or spreadsheet format is available, please provide copies of each individual use of force report or other report where use of force information is documented/reported by officers. Note, this is for all use of force incidents reported by your agency, not limited to only those incidents required to be reported under state or federal programs.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samuel Sinyangwe

title: Talking points and other material related to 4/19/2024 press conference

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Talking points and other material related to 4/19/2024 press conference
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any talking points, notes, or scripts prepared for the press conference mentioned here 

https://twitter.com/VibrantRRHA/status/1780986538077098003

created between April 1, 2024 and the time this request is processed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia.

communications.subject: Re: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Talking points and other material related to 4/19/2024 press conference
communications.communication:
Dear Tom Nash,

Richmond Redevelopment and Housing Authority (RRHA) acknowledges receipt of your FOIA request, dated January 23, 2026, January 8, 2026, and April 18, 2024 as you stated in your email, received in the FOIA department on January 23, 2026. I am not sure why your previous requests were not seen until today and apologize for the inconvenience that may have been caused. Your request is for talking points, scripts, and notes used to prepare for the press conference held on April 19, 2024.

The link provided did not work for me, however I located the press release and believe you are referring to the "RRHA Addresses Lease Enforcement Cases Due to Non-Payment of Rent" Press Conference held on April 19, 2024 at 10 a.m. Please let me know if I am incorrect.

Upon further review, a response will be provided to you within 5 business days of your initial request date. Day 1 is considered the day after your request is received. The five-day period does not include weekends or holidays.  If it is not practically possible to identify, locate, or provide the records you requested within 5 business days, RRHA may require an additional 7 business days to respond to your request pursuant to Va. Code § 2.2-3704(B)(4).

RRHA reserves the right to charge a reasonable fee for searching, duplicating, and supplying the requested records, but the fee shall not exceed the actual costs incurred. You may request an estimate of the cost in advance of receiving the requested records.  All requests received by RRHA are handled pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, Va. Code § 2.2-3700.

Please let me know if you want to modify your request or if you have any questions. Again, I apologize for this delay and any inconvenience this may have caused.

Sincerely,


[A close up of a sign  Description automatically generated]

iACT – Integrity, Accountability, Customer Focus, Teamwork
Defining who we are and how we do business!



Tonise A. Webb

Associate Lead Counsel and Chief Compliance Officer

600 East Broad Street,

Richmond, VA 23219

title: Request for Dept. of Correction Commissioners / Wardens Contact Information

communications.subject: Vermont Public Records Act Request: Request for Dept. of Correction Commissioners / Wardens Contact Information
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Vermont Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. A list of prison wardens and assistant wardens currently employed by the Vermont Department of Corrections, including for each record:

- Full names
- Job titles
- Assigned correctional facility
- Government-issued email addresses
- Government-issued phone numbers (direct desk numbers if available, otherwise department phone numbers with or without extensions)
- Department/division

2. A list of state-level commissioners/directors and deputy commissioners/directors currently employed by the Vermont Department of Corrections, including for each record:

- Full name
- Official job title
- Division / bureau
- Official work email address
- Official office phone number
- Official work mailing address

If available, I request this information be provided in a machine-readable format such as CSV or Excel.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Morgan P Hatch Jr

title: Report and BWC from Firearm Discharge in Hotel

communications.subject: Minnesota Government Data Practices Act Request: Report and BWC from Firearm Discharge in Hotel
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Minnesota Government Data Practices Act, I hereby request the following records:

On January 20, 2026 the Minnesota Star Tribune published an article titled "ICE agent accidentally fires gun into Eagan hotel room." To assist with your search, the article included: "The gunshot occurred Dec. 18, at the Hampton Inn Minneapolis-Eagan, located at 3000 Eagandale Place."

We are seeking additional information on this accidental discharge. Please provide the following records:
1) Police report and related supplements and media (photos/videos)
2) 911 Call Audio related to the incident 
3) BWC for responding officer(s)
4) Any interview transcripts or recordings (if separate from #1. If they are included in #1 then please ignore this line)

Thank you for taking the time to fulfill this request. Please feel free to send any of the above items as they become available, they do not all need to be sent at once.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Alan J. Segal

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: R000275-121625
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
RE: Public Records Request of December 16, 2025, Reference # R000275-121625 Dear Kung Joe, The Bellevue School District Public Records Office received the following public records request from you on December 16, 2025: To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

All email exchanged between Bellevue School District and the Washington State School Directors' association (*@wssda.org) for all time. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Kung Fu Joe 

Upload documents directly: https://www.muckrock.com/respond/2156999/ In accordance with , we are acknowledging receipt of your request and providing notice that the District will require additional time to respond. This time is needed to seek any clarifications to the request and to locate, assemble, and review the requested records.  RCW 42.56.520 Please note that this request may be subject to applicable fees as permitted by the PRA. RCW 42.56.120. The District charges 5 cents for 4 electronic files/or attachments. RCW 42.56.120(2)(b)(iii). We will let you know in advance if there will be a fee and whether, in keeping with RCW 42.56.120(4), a 10% fee deposit will be required before we proceed with your request. Please be aware that, in keeping with our obligations under the Washington Public Records Act (PRA), any information that personally identifies a student (unless the requestor is that student’s parent or guardian) must be redacted from all materials provided in response to a public records request. RCW 42.56.230(1). We ran some preliminary searches to get a sense for the number of potentially responsive emails. A search for emails from/to/cc @wssda.org returned only 8 emails, which have been uploaded here: Public Records Request - R000275-121625  A search for messages from/to/cc “wssda” returned 111,302 messages, many of which were mass mailings relating to news updates. When we ran a search omitting the most common of those bulk messages (using the search terms below), we had 29,840 messages. The applicable fee for that number of messages would be over $350 – and it seems possible that a large number of those emails might not be of interest to you. We ran that same search just for the period from 12/1/25 to 12/16/25 and had 31 results. We have attached those messages so you can take a look at the types of records the search is pulling up. If you have additional search terms you would like us to use or a specific date range that you would like us to pull first, please let us know. We want to make sure you get what you are interested in without unnecessary expense and without having to slog through records that are of no interest to you. Once we have your direction for a revised search, or your go-ahead to continue with the 29,840-result search, we will provide you with an anticipated fulfillment date and a fee estimate. Please let us know if you have any questions. Sincerely, Sarah Kolpacoff 
Public Records Officer

title: Military equipment (Brownsville Police Department)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Military equipment (Brownsville Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

An inventory of all military equipment held by the department as of the date of fulfillment of this request. The request includes but is not limited to: 

(1) Unmanned, remotely piloted, powered aerial or ground vehicles.
(2) Mine-resistant ambush-protected (MRAP) vehicles or armored personnel carriers. However, police versions of standard consumer vehicles are specifically excluded from this subdivision.
(3) High mobility multipurpose wheeled vehicles (HMMWV), commonly referred to as Humvees, two and one-half-ton trucks, five-ton trucks, or wheeled vehicles that have a breaching or entry apparatus attached. However, unarmored all-terrain vehicles (ATVs) and motorized dirt bikes are specifically excluded from this subdivision.
(4) Tracked armored vehicles that provide ballistic protection to their occupants and utilize a tracked system instead of wheels for forward motion.
(5) Command and control vehicles that are either built or modified to facilitate the operational control and direction of public safety units.
(6) Weaponized aircraft, vessels, or vehicles of any kind.
(7) Battering rams, slugs, and breaching apparatuses that are explosive in nature. However, items designed to remove a lock, such as bolt cutters, or a handheld ram designed to be operated by one person, are specifically excluded from this subdivision.
(8) Firearms of .50 caliber or greater.
(9) Ammunition of .50 caliber or greater.
(10) Specialized firearms and ammunition of less than .50 caliber, including assault weapons as defined in Sections 30510 and 30515 of the Penal Code.
(11) Any firearm or firearm accessory that is designed to launch explosive projectiles.
(12) “Flashbang” grenades and explosive breaching tools, “tear gas,” and “pepper balls,” excluding standard, service-issued handheld pepper spray.
(13) Taser Shockwave, microwave weapons, water cannons, and the Long Range Acoustic Device (LRAD).
(14) The following projectile launch platforms and their associated munitions: 40mm projectile launchers, “bean bag,” rubber bullet, and specialty impact munition (SIM) weapons.
(15) Any other military equipment purchased by/for or transferred to the department. 

Requested components of the inventory:
The inventory should include the manufacturer, model number, quantity, initial costs of obtaining the equipment, and estimated annual costs of maintaining the equipment of each type of equipment, where "type" means each item shares the same manufacturer model number. 

The inventory should also specify under which program the equipment was obtained if applicable, including but not limited to the 1033 Program, the 1122 Program, the US Department of Homeland Security Grant Program, US Department of Justice’s Justice Assistant Grant Program, DOJ Equitable Sharing Program, US Department of the Treasury Forfeiture Fund’s Equitable Sharing Program, and The General Services Administration Federal Surplus Personal Property Donation program.  

I am also requesting a list of all military inventory that has gone missing in 2024 and 2025. 

I am a journalist employed by the news outlet The American Prospect and I am requesting a waiver of all fees. The disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest and will contribute significantly to the public’s understanding of the tools available to the department to maintain safety and order, and protect against attacks from both domestic and outside sources.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Whitney Wimbish

title: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Seminole County Sheriff)

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Seminole County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2025. If possible, please provide this data in database or spreadsheet format and include the case number, incident date, incident time, subject injured indicator, subject injury force related info (e.g. Yes or No), subject age, subject gender, subject ethnicity, subject weapon type, incident area occurred, force type, officer division (e.g. law enforcement operations, detention/correctional operations, etc.), badge number and names associated with the officers involved. If one or more of these fields or dates is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If no database or spreadsheet format is available, please provide copies of each individual use of force report or other report where use of force information is documented/reported by officers. Note, this is for all use of force incidents reported by your agency, not limited to only those incidents required to be reported under state or federal programs.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Samuel Sinyangwe

communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST of January 29, 2026, Reference # R007365-012926. Samuel Sinyangwe, The Seminole County Sheriff's office received a public information request from you on January 29, 2026. Your request mentioned: 
Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2025. If possible, please provide this data in database or spreadsheet format and include the case number, incident date, incident time, subject injured indicator, subject injury force related info (e.g. Yes or No), subject age, subject gender, subject ethnicity, subject weapon type, incident area occurred, force type, officer division (e.g. law enforcement operations, detention/correctional operations, etc.), badge number and names associated with the officers involved. If one or more of these fields or dates is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If no database or spreadsheet format is available, please provide copies of each individual use of force report or other report where use of force information is documented/reported by officers. Note, this is for all use of force incidents reported by your agency, not limited to only those incidents required to be reported under state or federal programs. 
The Seminole County Sheriff's office has reviewed its files and has located responsive records to your request. Please log in to the records portal at the following link to retrieve the appropriate responsive documents. Public Records Request - R007365-012926 Sir, Any incidents prior to 2022 are contained in a reporting system to which we no longer have access. Additionally, you will need to download the report and open it to view the information correctly. Please let me know if you need anything further. Vivian Jones

communications.communication:
Dear Rose Terse: 
Thank you for your interest in public records of Skamania County. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with the State of Washington Public Records Act, Chapter 42.56 RCW and Skamania County Ordinance 2020-04 ( Skamania County Code Chapter 2.72). Your request was received in this office on 2/3/2026 and given the reference number C003886-020326 for tracking purposes.  Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

All current "Brady lists" and "Giglio lists" (per Brady v. Maryland/Giglio v. United States) maintained by your office, along with accompanying potential impeachment material. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Rose Terse 

Upload documents directly: https://www.muckrock.com/respond/2208085/ 
 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant department(s) to interpret and determine the size and complexity of your request, and to locate the records you seek. Within five (5) business days, you will receive a response confirming
receipt of your request. At that time, you will be provided with an
estimated date when requested records will be ready for release, a
request for clarification/additional information that will aid us in
locating/identifying records that may be responsive to your request, or
the record(s) will be released to you. 
 
PLEASE NOTE: The State of Washington Public Records Act, Chapter 42.56 RCW, does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below. You will receive an email when your request has been completed. 
 
It will also explain the costs associated with fulfilling your request, if any.  Again, thank you for using the Public Records Center. 
 
SKAMANIA COUNTY PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST

Attachments: 
Memorandum_Regarding_Potential_Impeachment_Information_Deputy_Ryan_Taylor.pdf (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.VEsWrlMiJDg0mXafq1mEXXKNHMGZjOd7qdQtHPrqDUSnThnOAjge8ztdyL9xIcfHcJ-2FbxPyhrYsO296qCMQ4ksLV0AeLB8FTdVj2TxPKIoOejmO9Hu5hjYGNuUgEsV3twh-2FGX8ct09m2q9036luX2U6JTVmSqInv5z5Jxubx0yS4NikHNONKe6JzJ-2FcFTPgf-2BK0TP4wY-2Bz22TO42gSbnbA-3D-3D9QSd_lhUZe-2BLXd-2BneSB-2BTZtjOVt2wFbPVps7QJsV-2B-2BSlReCUL0O0E4T5MYMxN5XaLaf5Bc5a2A60REPfDoCov-2BuA5kBIe2ZwemQDT8wzbzEM9hc5uwurAGiFw1vjpKX8NQBdwkLnaC-2B1Y0vCgyGg6Pp4GbeL6a4is4WgXvLQ3CT4WPu1YjpYQfsYqgl4is6zz4DG42UaSupiRWX5oS2WfWt7ujzF3JJEK81-2FkLDekrSI7R1wusz2ik5vnTim1Q-2BQNfOg2OXJI-2Bux5HkWCi065Y-2FvMaqouE0Amm4T3KavEamQ4MSQXnfT-2FVMUPb6EyC7-2Ff6GjXsB4MaZYclE44DRAT9m9uzOsnQsjD9OSPV-2BqfnAyGP29QKYLZssoec-2FF2jyt8iMyNISLmvVrrg5NN-2BCWOO2BP7A-3D-3D) 

--- Please respond above this line --- 
RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST of February 03, 2026, Reference #C003886-020326 Dear Ms. Terse: Greetings. My name is Joseph Anderson and I am a Deputy Public Records Officer for Skamania County. I assist inreviewing and responding to public records requests (PRRs) for alldepartments. 

On February 03, 2026, I received your public records request as follows: "To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

All current "Brady lists" and "Giglio lists" (per Brady v. Maryland/Giglio v. United States) maintained by your office, along with accompanying potential impeachment material. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Rose Terse 

Upload documents directly: https://www.muckrock.com/respond/2208085/." 
Please note that Skamania County does not have a ' Brady List' per se.  There is one (1) deputy that worksfor the Skamania County Sheriff’s Office for whom we have potentialimpeachment information and for whom we provide a memo disclosing and summarizing thecircumstances. We provide this memo when required to defense counsel oncases involving this deputy. Because there is only one (1) local deputy forwhom we maintain potential impeachment disclosure information, there is no list. Just the singlememo, which we are happy to provide [ please see attached]. 

TheWashington State Patrol sometimes sends us information from state-widepotential impeachment issues with WSP employees. We do not maintain thisinformation in any organized way because it does not apply to anyofficers that regularly appear in our courts/cases. I just want toconfirm that these records are not made into any list, and to the extentthat these records are related to WSP employees, are likely bettersought from the WSP directly, if you’re interested in the raw data (inaddition to any lists). After reviewing our files, we have located records that are responsive to your request. Please log in to the Skamania County Public Records Center at the following link to retrieve the records responsive to your request: County Public Records Request - C003886-020326
SkamaniaCounty has searched for, attempted to identify, locate, and provide anynon-exempt public records that may be responsive to this request. Since this completely fulfills your request, we are now closing this public records request. The one (1) yearstatute of limitations to seek judicial review under the Public RecordsAct (Chapter 42.56 RCW) begins now because Skamania County does notintend to further address this request. Please feel free to contact me if you have any further questions or concerns by replying to this email or at my phone number below. 

Sincerely, 

Joseph Anderson 
Deputy Public Records Officer 
Office of the Skamania County Prosecuting Attorney 
240 NW Vancouver Avenue | PO Box 790 
Stevenson, WA 98648 
509-427-3791

title: EXTERNAL COMMUNICATIONS - SAGE YMCA Title: External Communications - Sage YMCA (Wallingford Board of Education)

communications.subject: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: EXTERNAL COMMUNICATIONS - SAGE YMCA Title: External Communications - Sage YMCA (Wallingford Board of Education)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act (C.G.S. § 1-200 et seq.), I respectfully request access to the following public records:

PRIMARY RECORDS REQUESTED:
- All communications between YMCA staff and Wallingford Public Schools personnel from January 1, 2024 to present
- Documentation of any complaints, incidents, or issues involving YMCA members or programs from January 1, 2024 to present
- Records of staff training regarding confidentiality, member privacy, and professional boundaries
- Any communications with legal counsel regarding member disputes or staff conduct issues from January 1, 2024 to present

COMPREHENSIVE DISCLOSURE REQUIREMENTS:
This request includes, but is not limited to:
- All responsive records regardless of format (paper, electronic, audio, video, social media, messaging apps)
- Records stored on personal devices if used for official business
- Records in possession of contractors, consultants, or third parties acting on behalf of the agency
- Draft documents, notes, calendars, and informal communications
- Records that have been deleted but remain recoverable
- Metadata and audit logs associated with electronic records

SEARCH REQUIREMENTS:
- Search all relevant custodians, not just those specifically named
- Search all email accounts, shared drives, and backup systems
- Include records of employees no longer with the agency
- Search alternative spellings, nicknames, and partial names

PRODUCTION STANDARDS:
- Provide records in native electronic format when possible
- Do not convert searchable documents to non-searchable formats
- Preserve all metadata including timestamps and sender/recipient information
- Provide a privilege log for any claimed exemptions

If any responsive records have been destroyed, please provide:
- Documentation of the destruction
- Reason for destruction
- Date of destruction
- Authority for destruction

If you claim any exemption under the Freedom of Information Act, please:
- Identify the specific statutory exemption
- Explain how the exemption applies to each document
- Provide redacted copies where partial disclosure is possible
- Consider whether public interest outweighs any claimed exemption

This request seeks records that serve the public interest in government transparency and accountability. Please construe all exemptions narrowly and err on the side of disclosure.

Please preserve all potentially responsive records immediately upon receipt of this request to prevent spoliation.

As these records serve significant public interest, please waive all fees. If fees cannot be waived, please provide detailed cost estimate before proceeding.

Thank you for your assistance.

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

john Conrad

title: blended

communications.subject: North Carolina Public Records Law Request: blended
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the North Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Public reports show that this school district has been subject to curricula and book challenges: 

https://www.whqr.org/local/2025-05-09/wrightsboro-parent-pushing-for-book-ban-appeals-after-school-committee-rejects-their-challenge

Therefore, I request the following: 

1) All instructional materials, presentations and presentation materials (including recorded video and audio, PowerPoint files, prepared remarks, and slides formats), and other guidance related to “blended”, “dei”, "committee recommendation”, “administrative decision”, “determination letter”, “6th grade and up”, “policy 3200”, “policy 3210”, “privacy violation”, or “leak”. This includes A) any notes taken during meetings that discuss book bans B) any other document that has been used to help explain book bans, including internal documentation, public relations materials, and executive summaries.

2) Any digital communications (including but not limited to emails and text messages) as well as documents, (including but not limited to PDF, word processing, excel, and slide documents) about, pertaining to, or mentioning “josie barnhart”, “charles foust”, “blended” or “sharon draper”; “dei”, “diversity”, “edi”, “wrightsboro elementary”, or “stamped: racism, antiracism, and you”

3) Any emails, presentations, videos, memos, recordings, or other records mentioning  “josie barnhart”, “charles foust”, “blended” or “sharon draper”; “dei”, “diversity”, “edi”, "committee recommendation”, “administrative decision”, “determination letter”, “6th grade and up”, “policy 3200”, “policy 3210”, “privacy violation”, “leak”, “wrightsboro elementary”, or “stamped: racism, antiracism, and you”

Please perform this search for records between April 1, 2025 and the time this request is processed. This request is not for commercial purposes and will be used in the course of reporting for 404 Media, an independent, journalist-owned news site (www.404media.co).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Claire Woodcock

The contracts/agreements the school district most recently entered into with their school bus operator/provider (Summit/Durham/National Express/Other).

title: Boulder County Flock ALPR

communications.subject: RE: Colorado Open Records Act Request #R000116-011526
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. ALPR Locations: Please provide the precise location of each Flock Safety ALPR camera deployed and utilized by Boulder County Sheriff's Office.
2. Email Communications with Flock Safety (specifically emails sent to and received from email addresses ending in “@flocksafety.com”): All metadata(from address, to address(es), cc address(es), bcc address(es), date/time sent, date/time received, subject line, and names of all attachments. This request does not seek the contents of the emails themselves, only the specified metadata.) of email communications between Boulder County Sheriff's Office and Flock Safety between January 1, 2021 and the present.
3. Hotlist Criteria: Please provide documentation of policies detailing the criteria and procedures for creating and verifying entries on hotlists in Flock Safety's ALPR system. Specifically:
a. Criteria for adding entries to hotlists (e.g., offense types, jurisdictional warrants, etc.)
b. Verification and approval processes before hotlist alerts are actionable
4. Data-Sharing Agreements: List of all agencies with whom Boulder County Sheriff's Office shares ALPR data, both within Colorado and out-of-state, including federal entities.
5. Policies on ALPR Use and Oversight: Any formal policies or guidelines related to:
a. Acceptable and prohibited uses of ALPR data, including specific restrictions and permissible use cases
b. Access policy, including what constitutes a “valid reason” for system access
c. Human verification procedures for hotlist alerts before law enforcement action
6. Access Logs and Audits: Any access logs, audits, compliance reports, or oversight records evaluating the use, accuracy, and policy compliance of Boulder County Sheriff's Office ALPR systems between January 1, 2021 and the present.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Spratlin

communications.subject: Records Request :: R000116-011526
communications.communication:
Dear MATTHEW SPRATLIN: 
We appreciate your interest in criminal justice records of the Boulder County Sheriff’s Office. Your request was received on  1/15/2026 and will be processed according to the Colorado Criminal Justice Records Act (CCJRA), C.R.S. 24-72-301 et seq., and other applicable laws. Disclosure of records involving children may be restricted by the Children’s Code Records and Information Act, C.R.S. 19-1-301 et seq. 
The Sheriff’s Office Records Section does not process requests for public records under the Colorado Open Records Act (CORA), C.R.S. 24-72-201 et seq. Requests for public records under CORA should be submitted to the Boulder County’s Open Records Center available at https://bouldercounty.gov/records/colorado-open-records-act/. (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.VEsWrlMiJDg0mXafq1mEXaWhAOeQS4p-2FTifjFiHmIBToUhCNwPrijCljaecY3mINRUTFikS2djaQyg-2FJ7hIZ8luPa63HTgmuk3H1tWjGbKI-3DQW5S_Y6hkOFzc7Gmm3-2Bi7zo-2BZvuu4uIOBSkIp7jMmXKFRuYHJRlwdqXH86OpLg0WOws0MTIxkdrrxCuNEvvOPj2QMFlM-2FT-2FZ7glL-2BBqYg9N4wYHZ8lWuxVeAa-2B7P3ulgRA8fuExOEDO32UGNLt8gJiNNi-2FTmlOXJMMM5C6bP7PaJw-2F7l8wABoXl3wkVYCMFqPMD8UbKoFrnP9oUF-2FgVIN352e055NnrnUqbc7SpPbnSvla8Q-3D) 
You will receive an email when the response to your request is ready. While the Records Section is working diligently to respond, please note that the 3-day timeframe for inspection under CORA does not apply to requests for criminal justice records under the CCJRA. This request can be tracked at the link below using assigned reference number R000116-011526. 
The Sheriff’s Office also publishes certain criminal justice information online, including daily booking and listing reports for the Boulder County Jail, available at: https://bouldercounty.gov/safety/jail/listing-and-booking-reports/. (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.VEsWrlMiJDg0mXafq1mEXaWhAOeQS4p-2FTifjFiHmIBT2MJBJQmvdwUDiv0zYVq10kivwqXhRz5ZRo0NzoQrJNkh6yFBa-2FP7KQLm7eFSs948-3DpP8T_Y6hkOFzc7Gmm3-2Bi7zo-2BZvuu4uIOBSkIp7jMmXKFRuYHJRlwdqXH86OpLg0WOws0MTIxkdrrxCuNEvvOPj2QMFmKLNulZn-2FRuB2-2FuXNkTTOzLJFJlIucpmrnUfewSM76Sk5iGKQX7kfEvKZzeodUz-2B28lQGCUaemLEQi91br7cP1GeS8gScJHiYoQgC9C-2FbVNq9vqZJ2XXtctyOajwSoXHsSeZs8Sfzf9ox88G5zqe3A-3D) 
Thank you for using the records request center. 
Boulder County Sheriff’s Office 
 
To monitor the progress or update this request please log into the Records Request Center (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.VEsWrlMiJDg0mXafq1mEXZ1-2FPdBW8Q1BjPLvu8R38Ih5Vs8D-2FKYdTSTFPiP9LlOewvdyD75zx-2BhdIuphLSZ6TqXMxuN-2FiP-2Bw91l3ufz2YtM-3D8nnO_Y6hkOFzc7Gmm3-2Bi7zo-2BZvuu4uIOBSkIp7jMmXKFRuYHJRlwdqXH86OpLg0WOws0MTIxkdrrxCuNEvvOPj2QMFoeMMA8pEbbxYJpyqpbcTWolVjBDs0ycj2j-2F10UphRtdLkdDM-2FW2aUdGFB2oHiQfAnAPIE3o8NS7AWxWa-2FfBQxqJhSe80nM4OYefGSR5IqlIMzEfr9Rb7zIH8k73RYo-2B6-2FhWSFAd0HmJm3Ij7AZq32M-3D)

communications.subject: CORA Request :: C000035-012126
communications.communication:
Dear Matthew Spratlin: 
Thank you for your interest in the public information of Boulder County. Your request was received on 1/21/2026 and given the reference number C000035-012126 for tracking purposes. 
Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

1. ALPR Locations: Please provide the precise location of each Flock Safety ALPR camera deployed and utilized by Boulder County Sheriff's Office. 
2. Email Communications with Flock Safety (specifically emails sent to and received from email addresses ending in “@flocksafety.com”): All metadata(from address, to address(es), cc address(es), bcc address(es), date/time sent, date/time received, subject line, and names of all attachments. This request does not seek the contents of the emails themselves, only the specified metadata.) of email communications between Boulder County Sheriff's Office and Flock Safety between January 1, 2021 and the present. 
3. Hotlist Criteria: Please provide documentation of policies detailing the criteria and procedures for creating and verifying entries on hotlists in Flock Safety's ALPR system. Specifically: 
a. Criteria for adding entries to hotlists (e.g., offense types, jurisdictional warrants, etc.) 
b. Verification and approval processes before hotlist alerts are actionable 
4. Data-Sharing Agreements: List of all agencies with whom Boulder County Sheriff's Office shares ALPR data, both within Colorado and out-of-state, including federal entities. 
5. Policies on ALPR Use and Oversight: Any formal policies or guidelines related to: 
a. Acceptable and prohibited uses of ALPR data, including specific restrictions and permissible use cases 
b. Access policy, including what constitutes a “valid reason” for system access 
c. Human verification procedures for hotlist alerts before law enforcement action 
6. Access Logs and Audits: Any access logs, audits, compliance reports, or oversight records evaluating the use, accuracy, and policy compliance of Boulder County Sheriff's Office ALPR systems between January 1, 2021 and the present. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Matthew Spratlin 

Upload documents directly: https://www.muckrock.com/respond/2179756/ 
You will be contacted about the availability of records and/or provided with copies of the records. Depending on the scope of your request, a deposit and/or extension may be requested. If a deposit and/or extension is needed, Boulder County will contact you with an estimate before proceeding. All communications will be through the Boulder County Records Center. PLEASE NOTE: The Colorado Open Records Act (CORA) does not require Boulder County to create new records, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
You can monitor the progress of your request under " My Requests" in the Boulder County Open Records Center.

title: Police disciplinary files (Washington Office of the Attorney General)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Police disciplinary files (Washington Office of the Attorney General)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Any and all lists, spreadsheets or other organized datasets that detail potential or substantiated allegations of misconduct and/or impeached or impeachable testimony, created under Brady v. Maryland and/or Giglio v. United States.
- Any and all records regarding substantiated allegations of misconduct or violations of internal department policy or criminal law by specific law enforcement officers.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Moe Clark

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: Police disciplinary files (Washington Office of the Attorney General)

Dear Moe K. Clark, This correspondence is to update you on your public records request. You requested the following: - Any and all lists, spreadsheets or other organized datasets that detail potential or substantiated allegations of misconduct and/or impeached or impeachable testimony, created under Brady v. Maryland and/or Giglio v. United States. 

- Any and all records regarding substantiated allegations of misconduct or violations of internal department policy or criminal law by specific law enforcement officers. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 
An installment of records responsive to your request has been uploaded to Box. The records consist of a 294-page document (MC - 00001 thru MC - 00294) and 18 (MB) of native data. You may inspect and/or download these records via this link: https://atg-wa.box.com/s/1byeoqc7dljf0fw5k2zni49equyb8ezw . Please do so within 30 days. Records provided via Box are free of charge. You do not need a Box account to access the records. If a password is required to access the records, one will be provided to you in a separate email. Also uploaded with these responsive documents is a key to the codes indicated as black boxes with a code, e.g., [1a], centered. communications.subject: Request for Clarification - PRR-2025-0631
communications.communication:
Dear Moe K. Clark, This correspondence is to update you on your public records request. You requested the following: - Any and all lists, spreadsheets or other organized datasets that detail potential or substantiated allegations of misconduct and/or impeached or impeachable testimony, created under Brady v. Maryland and/or Giglio v. United States. 

- Any and all records regarding substantiated allegations of misconduct or violations of internal department policy or criminal law by specific law enforcement officers. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. This email is to seek clarification of your request. Our request for clarification is as follows: All Washington Brady-Giglio list, formally known as Potential Impeachment Disclosure (PID) under RCW 10.93.180, are required to be maintained by each individual law enforcement agency and reported to their county’s Prosecuting Attorney Office (PAO) within 10 days of an incident occurring. See RCW 10.93.180: Protocol for potential impeachment disclosures. There are 39 county prosecutors’ offices in Washington, and one of our divisions currently has about eleven lists in their possession but they may be outdated at this current juncture, and we are interpreting your request to be seeking the most up to date list. Nonetheless, we are more than happy to produce the limited materials we have but, if you are looking for the most accurate information available, you may want to contact the county prosecutors’ offices. Please let us know right away, but not later than October 3, 2025, if you wish to receive the approximate 11 lists. In addition, we have the following questions regarding the records you are seeking: 1.  may we apply a timeframe to your request? such as 2025? or the last year? 2.  may we apply a specific law enforcement agency? such as Olympia, WA Police Department or the Thurston County Sheriff's Department? Please let us know right away, but not later than October 3, 2025. If we do not hear from you on or before this date, we will begin producing records in installments as they come available. Please note that installments are provided free of charge via Box for inspection and/or download. You will not need a Box account to access the records. If you have any questions, please contact me via email or at Office of the Attorney General, Public Records & Constituent Services, P.O. Box 40100, Olympia, WA 98504-0100. Thank you. Sincerely, 
Bunny Archer Bunny Archer 
Public Records Officer & Constituent Correspondence Liaison 
Public Records & Constituent Services Unit 
Washington State Attorney General's Office 
PO Box 40100, Olympia, WA 98504-0100 
360-586-0725 | Bunny.Archer@atg.wa.gov

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request #PRR-2025-0631
communications.communication:
Hi Bunny,

Yes, I would like the 11 Lists and I will note that they might not be the most up-to-date. It is my understanding that there is no way for a law enforcement officer to be removed from a Brady List, so that is why I did not note a timeframe and requested the "most up to date." I have submitted the same request to the local agencies as well, so just seeking the lists in possession of the AG's office to compare with the local list.

Thank you!

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request #PRR-2025-0631
communications.communication:
Hello,

Thank you so much for your response, I will let the divisions know! For the narrowing portion, are you wanting to narrow at all or are you okay with the large amount of records that could take up to a year to complete?


Thank you,

Bunny Archer

Consequently, any information provided in this communication is of a general nature and should not be construed as an official opinion of this office or of the Attorney General.

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request #PRR-2025-0631
communications.communication:
Dear Moe Clark,

Thank you for your email. The records were provided to you in the format received. We did provide some records in native format, however, we do not have the pdf records in a .csv or Excel spreadsheet. The pdf should be searchable using “control F” and typing in the term you would like to search. For “raw data” you may wish to contact local law enforcement officials and or the Washington Association of Sheriffs & Police Chiefs (Public Records Requests<https://www.waspc.org/public-records-requests>) to ascertain whether they have this data in a .csv or .xls format.


Thank you,

Bunny Archer

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I'm following up on the following Washington Public Records Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on July 28, 2025. You had previously indicated that it would be completed on Feb. 6, 2026. I wanted to check on the status of my request, and to see if there was a new estimated completion date.  You had assigned it reference number #PRR-2025-0631.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: Records Uploaded - PRR-2025-0631 - Installment 6
communications.communication:
Dear Moe K. Clark, This correspondence is to update you on your public records request. You requested the following: - Any and all lists, spreadsheets or other organized datasets that detail potential or substantiated allegations of misconduct and/or impeached or impeachable testimony, created under Brady v. Maryland and/or Giglio v. United States. 

- Any and all records regarding substantiated allegations of misconduct or violations of internal department policy or criminal law by specific law enforcement officers. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 
An installment of records responsive to your request has been uploaded to Box. The records consist of a 792-page document (MC - 00001 thru MC - 00792) and 60 (MB) of native data. You may inspect and/or download these records via this link: https://atg-wa.box.com/s/k2x41unemau6nr1n1gd50prrd7crmelm . Please do so within 30 days. Records provided via Box are free of charge. You do not need a Box account to access the records. If a password is required to access the records, one will be provided to you in a separate email. Also uploaded with these responsive documents is a key to the codes indicated as black boxes with a code, e.g., [1a], centered. The key identifies the statutory basis for the exemption as well as a brief explanation for why the exemption applies. As you review the responsive documents, you will be able to refer to the key to identify the exemption and its application. We have made every attempt to apply consistent redactions on documents that contain the same information. In the event you locate documents that contain redactions that are not applied consistently, please let me know. If you prefer to receive these records on CD, USB thumb drive, or paper, there is a charge. Please see the AGO Public Records Fee Schedule for cost information. If you prefer one of these formats, please submit a check or money order to my attention within 30 days, in the amount specified on the Fee Schedule, payable to the Office of the Attorney General, and send it to the address below. Once payment is received, the records will be mailed. Please be advised that if you do not either download these records, access them for inspection, or submit payment for an alternate format on or before March 8, 2026, the request is considered to have been fulfilled and is closed on that date for failure to claim or review records. This means that the Attorney General’s Office will not further address the request, and that is the date from which the Public Records Act’s one-year statute of limitations to seek judicial review starts to run. Please contact me within 30 days via email or at Office of the Attorney General, Public Records & Constituent Services, P.O. Box 40100, Olympia, WA 98504-0100, if you have any questions. Thank you. Sincerely, 
Bunny Archer 
Public Records Officer & Constituent Correspondence Liaison 
Public Records & Constituent Services Unit 
Washington State Attorney General's Office 
PO Box 40100, Olympia, WA 98504-0100 
360-586-0725 | Bunny.Archer@atg.wa.gov

title: Watsonville - Airport Blvd

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Watsonville - Airport Blvd
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am stating the purpose of this request so that you may assist me as required by California Government Code (“Gov”) § 7922.600(a)(1). The purpose of this California Public Records Act request is to determine the existence or non-existence of a specific record. 

Please note that I am not requesting the record itself, only confirmation of its existence or non-existence. Thus, Civil Code § 1798.90.55, law enforcement exemptions, the public interest exemption or any other laws or exemptions do not apply to, and are not relevant to, this request. 

Please confirm the existence or non-existence of the following Flock Safety ALPR footage record:

License Plate: 9SYY133
Date: January 20, 2026
Time Frame: 12:05 PM - 12:15 PM
Camera Location: Airport Blvd in front of Watsonville Community Hospital
Camera Lat/long: 36.927511866270144, -121.79515700003752

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

David Moore

communications.subject: Your City of Watsonville, CA public records request #26-53 has been submitted.
communications.communication:
City of Watsonville, CA ************************************************************************ Your record request #26-53 has been submitted successfully. Dear Requester:  The City of Watsonville ("City") is in receipt of the Public Records Act request you submitted. The City intends to cooperate to the fullest extent possible with the Public Records Act ("PRA") (Government Code section 7920.000 et seq.) Under established California law, the City is obliged to comply with a request for a public record so long as the requestor makes a specific and focused request for information, that information is maintained by the City in its ordinary course of business, the information is disclosable, and the record can be located with reasonable effort. The PRA provides for the inspection or copying of existing identifiable public records; it does not compel the City to respond directly to questions or create new records, lists, or reports in response to a request. Within the next ten (10) days, we will determine whether your request seeks copies of disclosable records in the City's possession or whether the City will require an extension. Sincerely,   City Clerk's Office (831) 768-3048 275 Main Street, Suite 400, Watsonville, CA 95076 FAX: 831-761-0736 E-mail:  cityclerk@watsonville.gov Open Monday - Friday 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM ************************************************************************ Reply to this email or sign in to contact City of Watsonville, CA.

communications.communication:
City of Watsonville, CA ************************************************************************ Record request #26-53 has been closed. The closure reason supplied was: Dear David Moore, The City of Watsonville (“City”) is in receipt of the Public Records Act request you submitted, received on January 26, 2026 (“Request”). The City intends to cooperate to the fullest extent possible with the Public Records Act (“PRA”). (Government Code section 7920.000 et seq.) Under established California law, the City is obliged to comply with a request for a public record so long as the requestor makes a specific and focused request for the record, that record is maintained by the City in its ordinary course of business, the record is disclosable, and the record can be located with reasonable effort. The PRA provides for the inspection or copying of existing identifiable public records; it does not compel the City to respond directly to questions, requests for information, or create new records, lists, or reports in response to a request. the City has determined that it possesses records responsive to your Request. However, the City is withholding the responsive records pursuant to California Civil Code section 1798.90.55(b). (See also Cal. Gov. Code § 7927.705.). With this letter and production, the City considers this Request complete. If you have any questions regarding the City’s response or would like to discuss your Request, please contact me at cityclerk@watsonville.gov.
