title: Beckley City WV Opioid Settlement Funds Spring 2026

communications.subject: West Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Beckley City WV Opioid Settlement Funds Spring 2026
communications.communication:
Jessica Riley 
1511 University Avenue, P.O. Box 6010
Morgantown, WV 26506-6010
January 23, 2026 

Angela King
Grant Administrator
The City of Beckley
409 S Kanawha St Beckley, WV 25801
aking@beckley.org

Dear Angela King:
Under the West Virginia Freedom of Information Act, §29-B-1-1 et seq., I am requesting an opportunity to inspect or obtain copies of public records that pertain to Beckley’s opioid settlement funds. Specifically, I am requesting: 
- Documentation of the amount of funds the city has received from the federal opioid lawsuit settlements
- The application forms that any organization would submit to receive settlement funds
- Documentation of how much city-level funding has been awarded as of March 1, 2025, and to whom it was awarded
- Any completed application of an organization that has received settlement funds from the city
- Documentation of the process by which funds are awarded
- Any documents that contain the names of the individuals who review the funding applications and determine the awards
- Any documents that account for future plans from the city for the use of opioid settlement funds
If there are any fees for searching or copying these records, please inform me if the cost will exceed $25. However, I would also like to request a waiver of all fees in that the disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest and will contribute significantly to the public’s understanding of how the opioid settlement funds are being spent. I am a student journalist whose request is strictly for news-gathering purposes. This information is not being sought for commercial purposes. 
The West Virginia Freedom of Information Act requires a response to this request be made within five business days. If access to the records I am requesting will take longer than this amount of time, please contact me with information about when I might expect copies or the ability to inspect the requested records. 
If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law. 
Thank you for considering my request. 
Sincerely, Jessica Riley 
330-978-8228
jlr00026@mix.wvu.edu

title: Texas guidance on gender at San Jacinto, Alvin, Blinn (Alvin Community College)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Texas guidance on gender at San Jacinto, Alvin, Blinn (Alvin Community College)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any notes, slideshows, visual displays, handout materials, or recording (including video, audio, or written transcript) made by staff (excluding any employee with an academic or faculty appointment) or administrators with any meeting with department chairs or faculty concerning or mentioning gender, sex, "executive order", "obscene" material, HB 229, SB 412, or SB 12 or the content of dual-enrollment courses.

2. Any policy or written guidance concerning gender, sex, "executive order", "obscene" material, HB 229, SB 412, or SB 12 or the content of dual-enrollment courses.

3. Any instructions to faculty or department chairs concerning any review of courses, course material, or syllabi as that review pertains to gender, sex, "executive order", "obscene" material, HB 229, SB 412, or SB 12 or the content of dual-enrollment courses.

These requests are limited to records generated on or after September 1, 2025. Please note that these requests do not seek a search of any faculty, student, faculty organization, or student organization records, and no such search should be conducted.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

title: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Manatee County Sheriff's Office)

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Manatee County Sheriff's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2025. If possible, please provide this data in database or spreadsheet format and include the case number, incident date, incident time, subject injured indicator, subject injury force related info (e.g. Yes or No), subject age, subject gender, subject ethnicity, subject weapon type, incident area occurred, force type, officer division (e.g. law enforcement operations, detention/correctional operations, etc.), badge number and names associated with the officers involved. If one or more of these fields or dates is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If no database or spreadsheet format is available, please provide copies of each individual use of force report or other report where use of force information is documented/reported by officers. Note, this is for all use of force incidents reported by your agency, not limited to only those incidents required to be reported under state or federal programs.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Samuel Sinyangwe

communications.subject: Welcome to the City of Chicago Request Center!
communications.communication:
Dear Jacqueline Watkins, 
 
 
Thank you for registering with the City of Chicago Public Records Portal. 
If you did not submit your request through the public portal but are receiving this e-mail, we are excited to share with you that you can now submit FOIA requests through a newly implemented online request system. While you will still be allowed to email your FOIA requests, creating an account and submitting your request online will allow you to check the online portal for the status of requests. You will also receive an email when the records are ready to be downloaded. 
 
Please click here to visit our 
 Login: 202892-54155926@requests.muckrock.com 
 
If you have never used this system or cannot remember your password, please request a Temporary Password using the Forgot Password option on the login screen. 
 
This is an auto-generated email and has originated from an unmonitored email account. Please DO NOT REPLY.

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any reports from the OIDO office regarding overdoses, uses of force, or rape/sexual assault allegations at the Moshannon Valley ICE Processing Center in Philipsburg, PA beginning in January 2023 and continuing through the date the agency tasks an adequate search in response to this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free

communications.subject: Department of Homeland Security FOIA 2024-HQFO-01343 Final Response
communications.communication:
05/15/2024 

Andrew Free 
N/A 
MuckRock News DEPT MR 162789 
Boston, Massachusetts 02115 

Re:  2024-HQFO-01343 

Dear Requester: 

This is the electronic final response to your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), dated 4/29/2024, and received by this office on 4/29/2024.  You are seeking any reports from the OIDO office regarding overdoses, uses of force, or rape/sexual assault allegations at the Moshannon Valley ICE Processing Center in Philipsburg, PA beginning in January 2023 and continuing through the date the agency tasks an adequate search in response to this request. 

We conducted a comprehensive search of files within the DHS Privacy Office for records that would be responsive to your request.  Unfortunately, we were unable to locate or identify any responsive records. 

While an adequate search was conducted, you have the right to appeal this determination that no records exist within DHS Privacy Office that would be responsive to your request.  Should you wish to do so, you must send your appeal and a copy of this letter, within 90 days of the date of this letter, to:  Privacy Office, Attn: FOIA Appeals, U.S. Department of Homeland Security, 2707 Martin Luther King Jr. Avenue, SE, Mail Stop 0655, Washington, D.C. 20528-0655, following the procedures outlined in the DHS FOIA regulations at 6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.5(e)(2).  Your envelope and letter should be marked “FOIA Appeal.”  Copies of the FOIA and DHS FOIA regulations are available at www.dhs.gov/foia. 

If you need any further assistance or would like to discuss any aspect of your request, please contact the analyst below who processed your request and refer to 2024-HQFO-01343.  You may send an e-mail to foia@hq.dhs.gov, call 202-343-1743 or toll free 1-866-431-0486, or you may contact our FOIA Public Liaison in the same manner.  Additionally, you have a right to right to seek dispute resolution services from the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) which mediates disputes between FOIA requesters and Federal agencies as a non-exclusive alternative to litigation.  If you are requesting access to your own records (which is considered a Privacy Act request), you should know that OGIS does not have the authority to handle requests made under the Privacy Act of 1974.  You may contact OGIS as follows:  Office of Government Information Services, National Archives and Records Administration, 8601 Adelphi Road-OGIS, College Park, Maryland 20740-6001, e-mail at ogis@nara.gov; telephone at 202-741-5770; toll free at 1-877-684-6448; or facsimile at 202-741-5769. 

Provisions of FOIA allow DHS to charge for processing fees, up to $25, unless you seek a waiver of fees.  In this instance, because the cost is below the $25 minimum, there is no charge.
Regards, 

DHS FOIA, Privacy Office 
Department of Homeland Security 
2707 Martin Luther King Jr. AVE SE 
Mail Stop 0655 
Washington, DC 20528-0655 
E-mail: foia@hq.dhs.gov 
Visit our FOIA website https://www.dhs.gov/foia

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #2024-HQFO-01343
communications.communication:
Good morning,

We respectfully appeal the adequacy of this search. 

We believe adequate search — including iterative review and expansive term selection — of OIDO’s complaint database, inspection records, and notifications will yield responsive records and would be happy to provide specific dates within the original period on which records exist. 

Thank you,

Andrew Free

title: Founding Records of the Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE) Program (1999) (Department Of Homeland Security Cisa (cybersecurity And Infrastructure Security Agency))

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Founding Records of the Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE) Program (1999) (Department Of Homeland Security Cisa (cybersecurity And Infrastructure Security Agency))
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, 5 U.S.C. § 552, I hereby request copies of the following records:

The original Task Order or Statement of Work (SOW) issued to The MITRE Corporation in 1999, specifically authorizing the creation, development, and/or maintenance of the "Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures" (CVE) list/program.

The 1999 DARPA "Information Assurance" (IA) Program authorization documents that funded MITRE’s work on "common taxonomies" or "vulnerability enumerations" under the Air Force Electronic Systems Center (ESC) master contract.

The 2003 Memorandum of Agreement (MOA) or similar transfer document that shifted the sponsorship and funding of the CVE program from DARPA/DoD/Air Force to the newly formed DHS National Cyber Security Division (NCSD).

Record Description Clues: The CVE program was publicly launched in September 1999 following a white paper by David E. Mann and Steven M. Christey. At the time, MITRE was operating as a Federally Funded Research and Development Center (FFRDC) managed by the Air Force Electronic Systems Center (ESC) at Hanscom AFB.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brian Martin

title: Flock Safety ALPR Audits 2025 (Wheaton, Il Police Department)

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Flock Safety ALPR Audits 2025 (Wheaton, Il Police Department)
communications.communication:
RE: Flock Safety ALPR Audits

To the FOIA Officer of Wheaton, Il Police Department,

This request is made under the provisions of Illinois Freedom of Information Act. for the following records:

1. Organization Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of June 1, 2024, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency.

2. Network Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of June 1, 2024, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization’s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System.

Please provide the audit data in a structured format such as .csv, .xls, or another machine-readable database filetype.

3. Data Sharing
a. The names of agencies and organizations with which the Agency shares ALPR data
b. The names of agencies and organizations from which the Agency receives ALPR data
c. The names of agencies and organizations with which the Agency shares “hot list” information
d. The names of agencies and organizations from which the Agency receives “hot list” information

You may find that these requests result in a large number of files. These exports from the Flock system are standardized data formats that are inconsequential to redact. The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the case of any applicable fees, it is requested that an estimate of the total charges be provided prior to fulfilling this request. The preferred method of receipt is through electronic delivery.

Your assistance and cooperation in this matter are greatly appreciated. A response within 5 business days, as the statute requires is anticipated.

To the FOIA Officer of Wheaton, Il Police Department,

This request is made under the provisions of Illinois Freedom of Information Act. for the following records:

1. Organization Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of June 1, 2024, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Organization Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches done within the agency.

2. Network Audit in Flock.
The report should include data logged from the period of June 1, 2024, to the date this request is processed. Per Flock's documentation, the Network Audit is available within the Insights tab and is defined as searches of the organization?s Flock network by any agency in the Flock System.

Please provide the audit data in a structured format such as .csv, .xls, or another machine-readable database filetype.

3. Data Sharing
a. The names of agencies and organizations with which the Agency shares ALPR data
b. The names of agencies and organizations from which the Agency receives ALPR data
c. The names of agencies and organizations with which the Agency shares ?hot list? information
d. The names of agencies and organizations from which the Agency receives ?hot list? information

You may find that these requests result in a large number of files. These exports from the Flock system are standardized data formats that are inconsequential to redact. To remove private information, simply omit the "License Plate" column. We find that other agencies have had trouble with this until they realized they could do this.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

title: Malware NextGen platform source code

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Malware NextGen platform source code
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The complete source code (including full source repository data cloned by commands such as "git clone --mirror"), internal documentation, wiki, infrastructure-as-code ("IaC") data, and all other development and deployment machine-readable information related to the NextGen Malware analysis platform. including any dependencies, internal and external, necessary for its complete deployment and the source code for such dependencies.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Enzo Ludin

title: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Galveston County Sheriff)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Galveston County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2025. If possible, please provide this data in database or spreadsheet format and include the case number, incident date, incident time, subject injured indicator, subject injury force related info (e.g. Yes or No), subject age, subject gender, subject ethnicity, subject weapon type, incident area occurred, force type, officer division (e.g. law enforcement operations, detention/correctional operations, etc.), badge number and names associated with the officers involved. If one or more of these fields or dates is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If no database or spreadsheet format is available, please provide copies of each individual use of force report or other report where use of force information is documented/reported by officers. Note, this is for all use of force incidents reported by your agency, not limited to only those incidents required to be reported under state or federal programs.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samuel Sinyangwe

communications.subject: New Message - 2024-HQFO-01341
communications.communication:
"05/01/2024


SENT VIA E-MAIL TO: 162787-99868396@requests.muckrock.com

Andrew Free
MuckRock News DEPT MR 162787
Boston, Massachusetts 02115

Re: 2024-HQFO-01341

Dear Requester:

This acknowledges receipt of your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to the Department of Homeland Security (DHS), dated 4/29/2024, and seeking all OIDO working papers, notes, worksheets, and email correspondence regarding OIDO-23-0001 (https://www.dhs.gov/sites/default/files/2022-10/OIDO%20Final%20Inspection%20Report%20-%20Moshannon%20Valley%20Processing%20Center_2.pdf).

Your request was received in this office on 4/29/2024.

After careful review of your FOIA request, we determined that your request is too broad in scope or did not specifically identify the records which you are seeking. Specifically, there is no date range provided in this request. Records must be described in reasonably sufficient detail to enable government employees who are familiar with the subject area to locate records without placing an unreasonable burden upon the agency. For this reason, 6 C.F.R. Part 5 §5.3(b) of the DHS FOIA regulations require that you describe the records you are seeking with as much information as possible to ensure that our search can locate them with a reasonable amount of effort. Whenever possible, a request should include specific information about each record sought, such as the date, title or name, author, recipients, and subject matter of the records, if known, or the DHS component or office you believe created and/or controls the record. The FOIA does not require an agency to create new records, answer questions posed by requesters, or attempt to interpret a request that does not identify specific records.

A list of DHS Component and Offices is located online to aid in providing more information: https://www.dhs.gov/operational-and-support-components. Additionally, your identified DHS Components or Offices may have their own FOIA office for FOIA request submissions. A list of DHS FOIA Offices is located online: https://www.dhs.gov/foia-contact-information. If your identified DHS Component or Office has a FOIA office, please submit directly to that office. Otherwise, respond back with your additional information.

Please resubmit your request containing a reasonable description of the records you are seeking. This is not a denial of your request. Upon receipt of a perfected request, you will be advised as to the status of your request. If we do not hear from you within 30 days from the date of this letter, we will assume you are no longer interested in this FOIA request, and the case will be administratively closed.

You have a right to appeal the above determination. Should you wish to do so, you must send your appeal and a copy of this letter, within 90 days of the date of this letter, to: Privacy Office, Attn: FOIA Appeals, U.S. Department of Homeland Security, 2707 Martin Luther King Jr. Avenue, SE, Mail Stop 0655, Washington, D.C. 20528-0655, following the procedures outlined in the DHS FOIA regulations at 6 C.F.R. Part 5 § 5.5(e)(2). Your envelope and letter should be marked “FOIA Appeal.” Copies of the FOIA and DHS FOIA regulations are available at www.dhs.gov/foia.

You may contact the DHS FOIA Public Liaison at 202-343-1743 for any further assistance and to discuss any aspect of your request. You may also contact OGIS at the National Archives and Records Administration to inquire about the FOIA mediation services they offer. The contact information for OGIS is as follows: Office of Government Information Services, National Archives and Records Administration, 8601 Adelphi Road-OGIS, College Park, Maryland 20740-6001, e-mail at ogis@nara.gov; telephone at 202-741-5770; toll free at 1-877-684-6448; or facsimile at 202-741-5769.

Your request has been assigned reference number 2024-HQFO-01341. Please refer to this identifier in any future correspondence. If you have any questions, or would like to discuss this matter, please feel free to contact this office at 1-866-431-0486 or at 202-343-1743.

Regards,

DHS FOIA, Privacy Office
Department of Homeland Security
2707 Martin Luther King Jr. AVE SE
Mail Stop 0655
Washington, DC 20528-0655
E-mail: foia@hq.dhs.gov
Visit our FOIA website https://www.dhs.gov/foia"

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A list of the contacts at 13 property management software providers—including name, title, and company—that were sent a letter/email on December 8 regarding advertising total leasing prices. 
The letter was sent from Christopher Mufarrige, Director of the FTC’s Bureau of Consumer Protection.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tracie McMillan

communications.subject: Acknowledgment and Inform of Backlog
communications.communication:
Good morning,



Thank you for your reply. This correspondence confirms the receipt of your FOIA/PA request, seeking " list of 13 Property management Software Providers received Warning Letters (Press Release Dec. 9. 2025)." (simplified)



Due to the significant backlog caused by the federal shutdown, the FTC is processing requests as quickly as possible but has not yet begun to process yours. As soon as we are able, an individual FTC employee will reach out to let you know that they are starting work on your request and will provide their contact information.



In the meantime, if you have questions or concerns, please reach out to us at foia@ftc.gov<mailto:foia@ftc.gov>. You may also check the status of your FOIA request by visiting http://www.ftc.gov/about-ftc/foia/foia-reading-rooms/track-your-foia-request. This report is updated at the end of each month. If you should have any questions regarding your request, please contact us at foia@ftc.gov<mailto:foia@ftc.gov>. In any call or future correspondence concerning the request, please refer to the following case number FOIA-2026-00153.
Best,

FOIA Team

title: Request for Dept. of Correction Commissioners / Wardens Contact Information

communications.subject: South Carolina Public Records Law Request: Request for Dept. of Correction Commissioners / Wardens Contact Information
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the South Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. A list of prison wardens and assistant wardens currently employed by the South Carolina Department of Corrections, including for each record:

- Full names
- Job titles
- Assigned correctional facility
- Government-issued email addresses
- Government-issued phone numbers (direct desk numbers if available, otherwise department phone numbers with or without extensions)
- Department/division

2. A list of state-level commissioners/directors and deputy commissioners/directors currently employed by the South Carolina Department of Corrections, including for each record:

- Full name
- Official job title
- Division / bureau
- Official work email address
- Official office phone number
- Official work mailing address

If available, I request this information be provided in a machine-readable format such as CSV or Excel.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Morgan P Hatch Jr

Mr. Hatch,

The South Carolina Freedom of Information Act enumerates several matters which are exempt from disclosure pursuant to the Act or are excluded from the Act’s definition of a public record. Some of the records which you have requested in request 0413-25 are subject to one of these exemptions or exclusions. Specifically, some of the records you have requested are exempt or excluded based on the below listed sections of the FOIA statute. I have forwarded your request to the appropriate records custodians to obtain the requested documents if available.  You will receive these records within the applicable statutory timeframe pursuant to SC Code § 30-4-30(c). Please note that these records may be redacted pursuant to the below or any other applicable exemptions or exclusions.

Applicable exemption(s) and/or exclusion(s):
S.C. Code § 30-4-40(a)(2) A public body may exempt from disclosure information if release of that information would constitute an unreasonable invasion of personal privacy.
Sincerely,​
SCDC FOIA Office​

title: New York FOIL Policies (New York State Police)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: New York FOIL Policies (New York State Police)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. Annual reports prepared by or for the agency that detail response times, compliance statistics, or other data related to the processing of public records requests. If quarterly or monthly reports are available, please also provide those. 

2. Statistical data or reports regarding the agency’s (a) average, (b) median, (c) shortest, and (d) longest processing times for public records requests for each year from January 1, 2020 to present.

3. Records showing the total number of public records requests pending as of the date of this request. If available, please include a breakdown of pending requests by duration (e.g., pending less than 30 days, 30–90 days, more than 90 days).

4. Policies, procedures, guidelines, memoranda, or training materials concerning how the agency determines or calculates the "statement of the approximate date, which shall be reasonable under the circumstances, when the request will be granted or denied," as required by Public Officers Law § 89(3)(a).

Requests 1, 2, and 4 are limited to records generated or in use on or after January 1, 2020.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: FOIL Records Request :: R008965-051225
communications.communication:
Dear Adam Steinbaugh, 
This message confirms receipt of your request. Your request was received in this office on 5/12/2025 and given the reference number R008965-051225 for tracking purposes. Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. Annual reports prepared by or for the agency that detail response times, compliance statistics, or other data related to the processing of public records requests. If quarterly or monthly reports are available, please also provide those.

2. Statistical data or reports regarding the agency’s (a) average, (b) median, (c) shortest, and (d) longest processing times for public records requests for each year from January 1, 2020 to present.

3. Records showing the total number of public records requests pending as of the date of this request. If available, please include a breakdown of pending requests by duration (e.g., pending less than 30 days, 30–90 days, more than 90 days).

4. Policies, procedures, guidelines, memoranda, or training materials concerning how the agency determines or calculates the "statement of the approximate date, which shall be reasonable under the circumstances, when the request will be granted or denied," as required by Public Officers Law § 89(3)(a).

Requests 1, 2, and 4 are limited to records generated or in use on or after January 1, 2020.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fnew-york-state-police-354%252Fnew-york-foil-policies-new-york-state-police-186270%252F%253Femail%253DFoilUnit%252540troopers.ny.gov&url_auth_token=AAAdxtQDTbJZn1zrEWQN7fJqvoQ%3A1uEfbg%3AzKFhXGS3sedLFBsImHXN_Wj8wDYSNKzwYUEqGoV_TDg 
We will provide you with an acknowledgment within 5 business days. 
 
 
Sincerely, 
New York State Police

communications.subject: Extension :: R008965-051225
communications.communication:
RE: FOIL Records Request of May 12, 2025, Reference # R008965-051225 
Dear Adam Steinbaugh, 
The New York State Police received a FOIL request from you on May 12, 2025. 
 Please be advised that additional time is required to appropriately complete your request.  We estimate that a determination to grant or deny your request will be made on or before January 13, 2026. 
 This extension is necessary due to the high volume of record requests currently being processed by this agency. Additionally, the volume of records and the manner in which they are maintained may require time-consuming searches and retrieval efforts.  Further, as the records maintained by this law enforcement agency are generally sensitive in nature, thorough review of any responsive records is necessary to prevent the disclosure of confidential and/or sensitive information. 
 We will notify you in writing when/if the responsive materials are available for release or if the time needed to complete your request extends beyond the above date. 
Sincerely, 
New York State Police

--- Please respond above this line --- 
  
   
  
 
RE: FOIL Records Request of May 12, 2025, Reference # R008965-051225 
Dear Adam Steinbaugh, 
Reference is made to your correspondence received on May 12, 2025, seeking records as specified in Items #1 through #4 of your request. 

Please be advised that records from January 1, 2020 to October 8, 2024, were not kept in a database with respect to the terms and/or categories as set forth in your request that would permit practical retrieval.  Therefore, statistical data located regarding Item #2 and #3 of your request has been provided from October 9, 2024 to May 12, 2025 (date of request). 

Item #2: 
Average processing time from October 9, 2024 to December 31, 2024 - 71 Days. 
Average processing time from January 1, 2025 to May 12, 2025 - 56 Days. 
Median processing time from October 9, 2024 to December 31, 2024 - 47 Days. 
Median processing time from January 1, 2025 to May 12, 2025 - 13 Days. 
Shortest processing time from October 9, 2024 to December 31, 2024 - 0 Days. 
Shortest processing time from January 1, 2025 to May 12, 2025 - 0 Days. 
Longest processing time from October 9, 2024 to December 31, 2024 - 418 Days. 
Longest processing time from January 1, 2025 to May 12, 2025 - 336 Days. 

Item #3 
Total number of requests pending for less than 30 days from October 9, 2024 to December 31, 2024: 7. 
Total number of requests pending for less than 30 days from January 1, 2025 to May 12, 2025: 49. 

Total number of requests pending for 30-90 days from October 9, 2024 to December 31, 2024: 20. 
Total number of requests pending for 30-90 days from January 1, 2025 to May 12, 2025: 14. 

Total number of requests pending for more than 90 days from October 9, 2024 to December 31, 2024: 33. 
Total number of requests pending for more than 90 days January 1, 2025 to May 12, 2025: 221. 

The New York State Police has reviewed its files and has located a four (4) page record responsive to Item #4 of your request. Please log in to the FOIL Records Access Center at the following link to retrieve the responsive record. FOIL Records Request - R008965-051225 
Lastly, a diligent search of our files failed to locate any records for Item #1 of your request. APPEAL 
Pursuant to Public Officers Law § 89(4)(a), any person denied access to a record may appeal such determination in writing or through the FOIL Records Access Center within thirty (30) days.  If mailing, please state a specific ground for the appeal and send to: 
New York State Police FOIL Appeals Officer 
1220 Washington Avenue, Bldg. 22 
Albany, NY 12226-2252 
For more information on the FOIL Appeals process, please visit this FAQ.  
Sincerely, 
New York State Police 
1220 Washington Avenue, Bldg. 22 
Albany, NY 12226-2252

title: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Henry County Sheriff)

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Henry County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2025. If possible, please provide this data in database or spreadsheet format and include the case number, incident date, incident time, subject injured indicator, subject injury force related info (e.g. Yes or No), subject age, subject gender, subject ethnicity, subject weapon type, incident area occurred, force type, officer division (e.g. law enforcement operations, detention/correctional operations, etc.), badge number and names associated with the officers involved. If one or more of these fields or dates is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If no database or spreadsheet format is available, please provide copies of each individual use of force report or other report where use of force information is documented/reported by officers. Note, this is for all use of force incidents reported by your agency, not limited to only those incidents required to be reported under state or federal programs.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samuel Sinyangwe

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: December 29, 2025 involvement between San Luis Obispo Police and DHS.
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Requesting Memorandum of Understanding or Agreement between the San Luis Obispo Police Department and the U.S Department of Homeland Security (DHS) that authorizes assistance from the San Luis Obispo Police Department to the Department of Homeland Security or any related federal agency working thereunder, when the Department of Homeland Security or any federal agency thereunder is conducting operations within San Luis Obispo city or county. 

Also requesting assignment roster for all sworn officers on the date of 12/29/2025.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Shawn Harris

communications.subject: Records Request Response - PRR26016 Harris - Records relating to Department of Homeland Security and SLOPD
communications.communication:
Shawn Harris,

The document responsive to your request was reviewed by Eric Wooten, Paralegal. There are no other documents responsive to your request and the City considers this production to be complete. The responsive document can be found here: https://opengov.slocity.org/WebLink/Browse.aspx?id=220076&dbid=0&repo=CityClerk

Names of certain police officers were withheld pursuant to Penal Code, § 832.7(b)(6)(D), as there are specific, articulable, and particularized reasons to believe that disclosure of the unredacted records would pose a significant danger to the physical safety of the peace officer, custodial officer, or another person. The information is also exempt from disclosure under Government Code § 7922.000 because the public interest served by not disclosing the record clearly outweighs the public interest served by disclosure of the record.

Please be advised that every effort has been made to search for all records which may fall within the scope of your records request, and, as such, we believe our search is quite thorough. However, if you have knowledge of a specific document which has not been provided in response to your request, please notify us, and we will be happy to provide the document(s) to you unless, of course, it is exempt from disclosure pursuant to Government Code § 7921.000 et seq.

Andrea Colunga-Lopez

Thank you for responding to my public records request. If I understand correctly, there is neither a Memorandum of Understanding nor an Agreement that authorizes or describes any mutual aid between SLOPD and the US Department of Homeland Security? If not, what document or policy provides guidance when and if this occurs? Am I to understand that per your response, there is no policy of the SLOPD that would or does limit the SLOPD's breadth of assistance to the DHS or any agency working thereunder? Thank you.

communications.subject: RE: California Public Records Act Request: December 29, 2025 involvement between San Luis Obispo Police and DHS.
communications.communication:
Ms. Colunga-Lopez,

Thank you for providing a relevant section of the San Luis Obispo Police Department Policies and Procedures. I do not have any questions regarding this manual, I do however have a public records request related to a section of this document, to wit:

"414.6 FEDERAL REQUESTS FOR ASSISTANCE
Requests by federal immigration officials for assistance from this department should be directed
to a supervisor. The supervisor is responsible for determining whether the requested assistance
would be permitted under the California Values Act (Government Code § 7284.2 et seq.)."

Specifically,  I am requesting any document, email, or notification, in possession by the San Luis Obispo Police Department (SLOPD) received from either the US Department of Homeland Security or US Immigration and Customs Enforcement pertaining to their (ICE/DHS) activity in San Luis Obispo city and county on 12/29/2025.

Further, I am requesting any document or email from SLOPD responding to or acknowledging the aforementioned document, email, or notification from DHS/ICE  to SLOPD regarding their activity (DHS/ICE) on 12/29/2025.
 
Lastly, I am requesting the actual FEDERAL REQUEST FOR ASSISTANCE to the SLOPD from DHS or any agency thereunder related to their (DHS/ICE) activity in San Luis Obispo city and county on 12/29/2025. 

Having been surrounded by and detained (in the vernacular, "jumped") in the dark on 12/29/2025 in San Luis Obispo at 6:15am for no other reason than being impoverished and living in a rundown apartment complex with a large Hispanic population (also impoverished), by unknown masked individuals, including one one wearing a tactical vest (instead of a red coat) with a "police" patch on it without a badge (similar to another era's Gestapo or Stasi) and having not identified which agency's authority they were working under, I, as well as many of my entire state's impoverished Mexican-AMERICAN camarada, find these documents and their ability to turn our local, supine, prostrate, and compliant police departments, into nothing more than an extension of a hostile and insulated federal government located thousands of miles away (similar to England's relationship with America in its colonial past), to be of particular interest. Thank you. 

Shawn Harris

communications.subject: Records Request Response - PRR26022 Harris - Records relating to federal requests for assistance
communications.communication:
Shawn Harris,

The City of San Luis Obispo ("City") received your request pursuant to the California Public Records Act delivered via email on January 16, 2026. Today's production will complete our processing of the responsive documents and close the request.


  *   https://opengov.slocity.org/WebLink/Browse.aspx?id=220251

The document titled "Incident 251229015" includes a Summary Report and a Report Summary for an incident involving a request for assistance by DHS regarding a vehicle collision that occurred on December 29, 2025, in San Luis Obispo. SLOPD provided assistance in responding to the vehicle collision, but this assistance was not related to immigration enforcement. The document titled "12.29.25 Summary Reports" contains three Summary Reports that were created in response to DHS notifying SLOPD via phone call that DHS would be in the identified areas. These Summary Reports were created for the purpose of department awareness; SLOPD personnel did not respond to those locations or otherwise assist with DHS operations.

Please be advised that every effort has been made to search for all records which may fall within the scope of your records request, and, as such, we believe our search is quite thorough. However, if you have knowledge of a specific document which has not been provided in response to your request, please notify us, and we will be happy to provide the document(s) to you unless, of course, it is exempt from disclosure pursuant to California Government Code §7921.000 et seq.

Best,

Andrea Colunga-Lopez

Shawn Harris

communications.subject: Records Request DETERMINATION & FINAL - PRR26030 Harris - SLOPD records regarding 12/29 incident
communications.communication:
Shawn Harris,

You have requested records of the following:

  1.  Badge number of Watch Commander who participated in a call at 6:27am on 12/29/2025 regarding DHS conducting activity in the area. No Watch Commander or other officers of SLOPD participated in telephone calls with DHS on 12/29/2025. You spoke with Sgt. Brewer (badge #99297) on that date, who informed you that the department had been made aware of DHS activity in the area on that date. This information was provided by DHS to general police dispatch. Those records were provided to you on January 22, 2026 (file name "12.29.25 Summary Reports".)
  2.  Transcript or recording of the phone call involving the Watch Commander See above. No responsive records exist for this request.
  3.  Copy of report and related documents regarding vehicle collision on 12/29/25 that the Department of Homeland Security requested assistance from SLOPD (possibly at 777 Mill Street). This information was provided to you on January 22, 2026 (file name "Incident 251229015").
  4.   Any reports of stolen vehicles occurring between 12/22/2025 and 12/29/2025. This information is available online via the City's public facing crime dashboard at: https://www.slocity.org/government/department-directory/police-department/community-crime-mapping
With this response we consider your request closed.

Sara Armas

title: Flock emails

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Flock emails
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All emails sent to city.council@mountainview.gov with the word "Flock" in the subject line sent in the last 30 days.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Eva Tang

title: Revised Statement of Planned Business Operation Hat City Ale House Danbury, CT

communications.subject: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: Revised Statement of Planned Business Operation Hat City Ale House Danbury, CT
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide copy or copies of "Revised Statement of Planned Business Operation of Paige Enterprises, Inc. D/B/A Hat City Ale House" for Hat City Ale House 253 Main St, Danbury, CT in your possession in paper form. Please include document marked with "1" in the upper right hand corner. Additionally please note when each document was received by your department.

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kevin Paige

communications.subject: RE: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: Revised Statement of Planned Business Operation Hat City Ale House Danbury, CT
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following Connecticut Freedom of Information Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on Jan. 6, 2026. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: FOIA Request
communications.communication:
Good Afternoon Mr. Paige:


This will acknowledge receipt of your letter received on January 12, 2026,
wherein you requested information pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of
Information Act.


Please be advised that the City of Danbury is firmly committed to providing
prompt access to all records subject to disclosure under Connecticut
General Statutes §1-210, et. seq.  Accordingly, all documents will be
assembled and reviewed as quickly as reasonably possible in light of other
responsibilities and immediate commitments.  Although the City of Danbury
takes your request seriously and will respond as promptly as possible, we
reserve the right to petition the Freedom of Information Commission for a
declaratory ruling regarding requests that may be exempt from disclosure.



Please note, that there will be a charge of $.50 per page, and any amount
of over $10.00 must be paid in advance.



If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact me.

-- 
[image: photo]
*Tracy L. Norris*
Assistant Corporation Counsel
City of Danbury

( <(203)+797-4625+x7356>203)797-4518 ext. 7213 | t.norris@danbury-ct.gov

(203)796-8043 Fax

155 Deer Hill Avenue, Danbury, CT 06810

communications.subject: Re: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: Revised Statement of Planned Business Operation Hat City Ale House Danbury, CT
communications.communication:
Good Morning Mr. Paige:

Please be advised that your FOIA request is being processed.  As you are
aware you submitted several requests for multiple documents  to the
health department.  Each request must be processed and then responsive
documents sent to this office for review.   Once that occurs, all
non-exempt documents will be sent to you.

Given the abundance of requests the City receives, each request is taken in
the order it was received, and documents are produced as soon as possible
in light of all other commitments. That being said, I am anticipating that
your documents will be sent within the next 15 to 30 days.

-- 
[image: photo]
*Tracy L. Norris*
Assistant Corporation Counsel
City of Danbury

title: 2026 Brady List (San Juan County Prosecuting Attorney)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: 2026 Brady List (San Juan County Prosecuting Attorney)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All current "Brady lists" and "Giglio lists" (per Brady v. Maryland/Giglio v. United States) maintained by your office, along with accompanying potential impeachment material.

title: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Pittsylvania County Sheriff's Department (Virginia))

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Pittsylvania County Sheriff's Department (Virginia))
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2025. If possible, please provide this data in database or spreadsheet format and include the case number, incident date, incident time, subject injured indicator, subject injury force related info (e.g. Yes or No), subject age, subject gender, subject ethnicity, subject weapon type, incident area occurred, force type, officer division (e.g. law enforcement operations, detention/correctional operations, etc.), badge number and names associated with the officers involved. If one or more of these fields or dates is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If no database or spreadsheet format is available, please provide copies of each individual use of force report or other report where use of force information is documented/reported by officers. Note, this is for all use of force incidents reported by your agency, not limited to only those incidents required to be reported under state or federal programs.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Samuel Sinyangwe.

Older records were redacted as allowed by Virginia Code § 2.2-3706(B)(9), and some of the specific data elements requested are not contained in either system, as they were not collected or maintained by this agency. communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Official Military Personnel File (OMPF) concerning Holland E. Bynam
Name of Veteran: Holland Bynam
Branch: United States Army
DOB: July 26, 1935
Dates of Service: 1954 - 1984

Please provide the following military service information:
1. dates of service, dates of ranks, stations, list of awards, decorations, Badges, campaigns, assignments, Vietnam War service dates

3. request copy of Silver Star Medal award citations 
4. Military Education/ training courses, military schools
5. copy of Bronze Star Medal award citations
6. request copy of Army commendation award citations
7 request copy of legion of merit award citation
8. Section V MISCELLANEOUS Form

I request copies of paperwork in the file showing this information

First name: Holland
Middle initial: E
Last name: Bynam
date of birth - 07/26/1935
Rank - Colonel

title: Vermont HHS response

communications.subject: Vermont Public Records Act Request: Vermont HHS response
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Vermont Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Communications and correspondence with the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services regarding the Aug. 26, 2025, HHS letter requesting the Vermont Department of Health remove content from the state's Personal Responsibility Education Program curricula and program materials. For reference, the letter can be found here: https://acf.gov/sites/default/files/documents/main/08.26.25-Combined-PREP-Letters.pdf.

I also request internal communications between any Vermont Department of Health employees about the aforementioned letter. If the content changes were made, I request a copy of the material before it was changed as well as a copy of the material after it was changed.

I additionally request that, if possible, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ileana Garnand

communications.subject: City of Seattle Public Records Request Center - Invoice Ready :: P253299-011926
communications.communication:
This email is in further response to your public disclosure records request P253299-011926. The Seattle Police Department has records ready to be released pending payment. 
 
You have 30 days from today's date to pay for your records. If the City does not receive your payment within this time period, your request will be considered abandoned, and you will need to submit a new request. 
 SPD strongly encourages online payments. 
 
To pay online, please follow these steps: 
 
  * Navigate to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * Select 'My Records Request Center'. 
  * Select 'View My Requests'. You may be asked to login. 
  * Find this request: P253299-011926. 
  * Select the 'View Invoices' button. 
 
  * Opens a pop-up window showing your invoice: INV26-P253299-1. 
  * Click on the invoice and then the 'Pay Now' button. 
  * Continue processing your payment. 
  * Select 'Done'. 
  * Once the payment process is done, you are returned to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * After your payment is successful you will receive an email from our payments center. After we receive your payment through the Police Records Request Center Secure Payments, the Public Disclosure Unit will release your records within one to two business days and send you a notice with instructions on how to download the records. 
 Please add seattle@mycusthelp.net to your E-mail contacts/address book to ensure delivery of the record center E-mails to your Inbox. (mailto:seattle@mycusthelp.net) 
 
This is an auto-generated email and has originated from an unmonitored email account. Please DO NOT REPLY.

communications.subject: Public Records Center - Police :: P253299-011926
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

02/05/2026 
 
Rose Terse 
202779-17824628@requests.muckrock.com 
 
RE: Public Disclosure Request#: P253299-011926 
 
Dear Rose Terse, 
 
Dear Rose Terse, 
Your records have been released and are available on the Public Records Request Center to download. The records responsive to your request is the staff roster by name in a CSV format. This completes the request. 
To download your records, please: 
 
  * Navigate to the Public Records Request Center.
  * Select 'My Records Request Center'. 
  * Select 'View My Requests'. You may be asked to login. 
  * Select this request: P253299-011926. 
  * Select the 'View Files' button. 
  * You can download records individually or all at the same time by clicking 'Download All'. 
  *  Please save your records as you may only download them from the system three times. If you do not download your records within 30 days of request closure, the link to your records will expire. 
If you believe you have received privileged or confidential records in error, please notify the City of Seattle immediately, through the Public Records Request Center or by email. Privileged or confidential records provided or received in error should not be reviewed, used, disseminated, distributed, or copied, and should be destroyed immediately. Thank you in advance for your cooperation. 
SPD will take no further action on this request. If you have questions regarding the processing of this request or would like to initiate an administrative appeal regarding the response to your request, please do so within 10 business days. You may also seek judicial review of our response to your request for a period of one year, beginning as of the date of this message, consistent with RCW 42.56.550. 
Please include your name and address, a copy of any redacted files, and a copy of this letter together with a brief statement identifying the basis of the appeal. 
Please submit your appeal via GovQA, the mail, or deliver your appeal to: 
Seattle Police Department 
Attn: Legal Section 
610 Fifth Avenue 
P.O. Box 34986 
Seattle, WA 98124-4986 
 
If you have any questions, you may send a message using the Police Records Request Center or call the Public Disclosure Desk at 206-684-5481. 
 
Sincerely, 
Justin Jackson 
Seattle Police Department 
Legal Unit 
 
SPD receives over 13,000 public records requests annually and is processing between 2,500 to 3,000 open requests at any given time. This may result in a slower than anticipated response to your request. Thank you for your 
patience. 
 
As a reminder you can login at the Police Records Request Center where you can access Police online information, manage your profile, submit record requests, track your request status, receive and send messages, make payments, view frequently asked questions, and download your records.
 Please add seattle@mycusthelp.net to your E-mail contacts/address book to ensure delivery of the record center E-mails to your Inbox. (mailto:seattle@mycusthelp.net) 
 
This is an auto-generated email and has originated from an unmonitored email account. Please DO NOT REPLY.

title: Sacramento FOIA (Sacramento County Sheriff's Department)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Sacramento FOIA (Sacramento County Sheriff's Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

My understanding is that Sacramento recently ended its red light camera program. Pursuant to public records laws, I would like to request a copy of the red light camera contract with the vendor American Traffic Solutions (also known as Verra Mobility and/or RedFlex), as well as any extensions or revisions of the contract.

https://www.sacbee.com/news/local/crime/article286712290.html 

I would also like to request the correspondence communicating to the vendor to discontinue/end/terminate the red light camera program/contract. 

Please provide me these records via email.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jon Smith

RE: FOIL Records Request of October 15, 2024, Reference # R004331-101524 
Dear Julia Rock, 
The NYS Department of Health received a FOIL request from you on October 15, 2024. You requested: "[...]Your agency's Records Retention and Disposition Schedule 
- Your agency's FOIL log for January 1, 2023 to the date this request is processed[...] 

Sincerely, 

Julia Rock" 
The NYS Department of Health has reviewed its files and located records responsive to your request. However, certain portions of the records are exempt from disclosure and have been redacted pursuant to the following New York Public Officers Law exemptions: 
 
  * §87(2)(a) precludes access to records that are specifically exempted from disclosure by state or federal statute. New York State Public Health Law, Title X – Article 13 Section 1370-a (2)(c). In accordance with New York State law and the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996 (HIPAA), the Department requires a HIPAA authorization form from any individual who resided at the subject property, as the records you are requesting necessarily implicate protected health information of anyone who resided there. 
  * §87(2)(b), because disclosure “would constitute an unwarranted invasion of personal privacy.” Within responsive materials, cells with a sample size of six or fewer individuals have been redacted to ensure the privacy of patients. 
  * §87(2)(f), because “if disclosed could endanger the life or safety of any person.” 
  * §87(2)(g), as “inter-agency or intra-agency materials.” 
  * §87(2)(i), to “guarantee the security of … information technology assets.” 
Please log in to the FOIL Records Access Center at the following link to review the responsive records. FOIL Records Request - R004331-101524 
Should you feel that you have been unlawfully denied access to records, you may submit an appeal online within 30 days. 
For questions or additional information, please reply to this email. 
Sincerely, 
David J. Harvey, Records Access Officer 

NYS Department of Health To monitor the progress or update this request please log into the FOIL Records Access Center.

title: Military equipment (New Mexico State Police)

communications.subject: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Military equipment (New Mexico State Police)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

An inventory of all military equipment held by the department as of the date of fulfillment of this request. The request includes but is not limited to: 

(1) Unmanned, remotely piloted, powered aerial or ground vehicles.
(2) Mine-resistant ambush-protected (MRAP) vehicles or armored personnel carriers. However, police versions of standard consumer vehicles are specifically excluded from this subdivision.
(3) High mobility multipurpose wheeled vehicles (HMMWV), commonly referred to as Humvees, two and one-half-ton trucks, five-ton trucks, or wheeled vehicles that have a breaching or entry apparatus attached. However, unarmored all-terrain vehicles (ATVs) and motorized dirt bikes are specifically excluded from this subdivision.
(4) Tracked armored vehicles that provide ballistic protection to their occupants and utilize a tracked system instead of wheels for forward motion.
(5) Command and control vehicles that are either built or modified to facilitate the operational control and direction of public safety units.
(6) Weaponized aircraft, vessels, or vehicles of any kind.
(7) Battering rams, slugs, and breaching apparatuses that are explosive in nature. However, items designed to remove a lock, such as bolt cutters, or a handheld ram designed to be operated by one person, are specifically excluded from this subdivision.
(8) Firearms of .50 caliber or greater.
(9) Ammunition of .50 caliber or greater.
(10) Specialized firearms and ammunition of less than .50 caliber, including assault weapons as defined in Sections 30510 and 30515 of the Penal Code.
(11) Any firearm or firearm accessory that is designed to launch explosive projectiles.
(12) “Flashbang” grenades and explosive breaching tools, “tear gas,” and “pepper balls,” excluding standard, service-issued handheld pepper spray.
(13) Taser Shockwave, microwave weapons, water cannons, and the Long Range Acoustic Device (LRAD).
(14) The following projectile launch platforms and their associated munitions: 40mm projectile launchers, “bean bag,” rubber bullet, and specialty impact munition (SIM) weapons.
(15) Any other military equipment purchased by/for or transferred to the department. 

Requested components of the inventory:
The inventory should include the manufacturer, model number, quantity, initial costs of obtaining the equipment, and estimated annual costs of maintaining the equipment of each type of equipment, where "type" means each item shares the same manufacturer model number. 

The inventory should also specify under which program the equipment was obtained if applicable, including but not limited to the 1033 Program, the 1122 Program, the US Department of Homeland Security Grant Program, US Department of Justice’s Justice Assistant Grant Program, DOJ Equitable Sharing Program, US Department of the Treasury Forfeiture Fund’s Equitable Sharing Program, and The General Services Administration Federal Surplus Personal Property Donation program.  

I am also requesting a list of all military inventory that has gone missing in 2024 and 2025. 

I am a journalist employed by the news outlet The American Prospect and I am requesting a waiver of all fees. The disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest and will contribute significantly to the public’s understanding of the tools available to the department to maintain safety and order, and protect against attacks from both domestic and outside sources.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Whitney Wimbish

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The results of the DNA test of the shoelace recovered from the double homicide of Brian and Katie Maggiore. The evidence was received by Inv. Larry Pool of the Orange County Sheriff's Department on 5/1/03. The test results were dated 6/16/03 and compared to semen recovered from the Harrington case.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Neville

title: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Madison County Sheriff)

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Sheriff use of force data (2017-2025) (Madison County Sheriff)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2025. If possible, please provide this data in database or spreadsheet format and include the case number, incident date, incident time, subject injured indicator, subject injury force related info (e.g. Yes or No), subject age, subject gender, subject ethnicity, subject weapon type, incident area occurred, force type, officer division (e.g. law enforcement operations, detention/correctional operations, etc.), badge number and names associated with the officers involved. If one or more of these fields or dates is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If no database or spreadsheet format is available, please provide copies of each individual use of force report or other report where use of force information is documented/reported by officers. Note, this is for all use of force incidents reported by your agency, not limited to only those incidents required to be reported under state or federal programs.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samuel Sinyangwe

Samuel Sinyangwe
