communications.subject: Sheriff's Office Public Records :: S004318-012826
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

 
RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST of January 28, 2026., Reference # S004318-012826. 
Dear Samuel Sinyangwe, Thank you for writing to the Madison County Sheriff’s Office with your request for information pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (“FOIA”).  In particular, on January 28, 2026, you requested the following: “Use of force (UOF) data dating from January 1, 2017 to December 31, 2025. If possible, please provide this data in database or spreadsheet format and include the case number, incident date, incident time, subject injured indicator, subject injury force related info (e.g. Yes or No), subject age, subject gender, subject ethnicity, subject weapon type, incident area occurred, force type, officer division (e.g. law enforcement operations, detention/correctional operations, etc.), badge number and names associated with the officers involved. If one or more of these fields or dates is unavailable, provide all fields and/or information that is available responsive to my request. If no database or spreadsheet format is available, please provide copies of each individual use of force report or other report where use of force information is documented/reported by officers. Note, this is for all use of force incidents reported by your agency, not limited to only those incidents required to be reported under state or federal programs.”  With regards to your request, this request is denied in part and granted in part. The reporting requirement for submitting use of force reports to the Illinois State Police became effective on January 31, 2022 and only pertains to any action which resulted in death or serious bodily injury of a person or the discharge of a firearm at or in the direction of a person, See Ill. Admin. Code tit. 20, § 1244.30.  Therefore, this response is for the time period of January 31, 2022 through present.  Attached, hereto please find the following: 
 
  *  Use of Force Report for December 22, 2024 Incident 
  *  Use of Force Report for October 1, 2024 Incident 
  *  Use of Force Report for February 7, 2024 Incident Use of Force Report for July 20, 2022 Incident You have a right to have the denial of your request reviewed by the Public Access Counselor (“PAC”) at the Office of the Illinois Attorney General. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a) . You can file your Request for Review with the PAC by writing to: Public Access Counselor Office of the Attorney General 500 South 2 nd Street Springfield, Illinois 62706 Fax: 217-782-1396 E-mail: publicaccess@atg.state.il.us You also have the right to seek judicial review of your denial by filing a lawsuit in the appropriate county circuit court. 5 ILCS 140/11. If you choose to file a Request for Review with the PAC, you must do so within 60 calendar days of the date of this denial letter. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). Please note that you must include a copy of your original FOIA request and this denial letter when filing a Request for Review with the PAC. 
Sincerely, 
Jaimie Linton 
Administrator of Business 
Sheriff

title: Florida Public Records Request: FACES Facial Recognition System (Okaloosa County Sheriff's Department)

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Florida Public Records Request: FACES Facial Recognition System (Okaloosa County Sheriff's Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Public Records Law (Chapter 119, Florida Statutes), I hereby request the following records related to Okaloosa County Sheriffs Department's use of and access to the Pinellas County Sheriff's Office Face Analysis Comparison & Examination System (FACES) and related surveillance technologies:

1. FACES SYSTEM ACCESS POLICIES AND PROCEDURES:
   - All current written policies governing the department's use of the FACES facial recognition system
   - All memoranda of understanding (MOUs), memoranda of agreement (MOAs), interagency agreements, or contracts with Pinellas County Sheriff's Office or any other entity related to FACES access
   - Training materials provided to personnel authorized to use FACES
   - Standard operating procedures (SOPs) for conducting FACES searches
   - Documents describing civil rights protections, limitations on use, or oversight mechanisms for FACES searches

2. ADMINISTRATIVE LOGS AND USAGE RECORDS:
   - Organization Audit reports from FACES showing searches conducted by department personnel for the period of January 1st, 2026 to the date this request is processed if available
   - Documents sufficient to show:
     * Total number of FACES searches conducted by the department
     * User logs identifying which personnel conducted searches (names may be redacted if required by law, but please include badge numbers or employee IDs)
     * Case numbers or incident reports associated with each search
     * Stated reasons or justifications for each search
     * Any internal audit reports reviewing FACES usage for compliance or misuse

3. INTEGRATION AND RELATED TECHNOLOGIES:
   - All contracts, agreements, purchase orders, invoices, or correspondence with FUSUS/Axon or any entity related to FUSUS system implementation or integration
   - Documents describing any integration between FACES and the FUSUS platform or any other real-time surveillance systems
   - Technical specifications or system architecture documents showing how FACES connects or shares data with other surveillance technologies including but not limited to:
     * FUSUS real-time camera integration platform
     * Automated License Plate Readers (ALPRs)
     * Predictive policing systems
     * Body-worn cameras
     * ShotSpotter or other gunshot detection systems
     * Private camera registries
   - Any assessments, reports, or internal communications discussing the integration of FACES with other surveillance technologies
   - Documents describing any real-time crime center operations that utilize FACES

4. PERFORMANCE AND ACCURACY:
   - Any internal assessments, audits, or external reports evaluating the accuracy, effectiveness, or reliability of FACES
   - Documents addressing known error rates, particularly regarding demographic disparities
   - Any false positive reports or case files where FACES identification was determined to be incorrect

5. POLICY UPDATES AND OVERSIGHT:
   - Communications with Pinellas County Sheriff's Office regarding policy updates or requirements implemented in 2024
   - Documents related to any citizen oversight, internal affairs reviews, or complaints regarding FACES usage
   - Any reports provided to elected officials, oversight bodies, or the public regarding FACES usage

================================================================================

IMPORTANT CLARIFICATION REGARDING SCOPE OF REQUEST:

This request does NOT seek:
- Personally identifiable information (PII) of individuals who have been subjects of searches or investigations, including names, addresses, dates of birth, social security numbers, or biometric data of searched individuals
- Photographs, facial recognition images, or biometric templates of any individuals in the FACES database
- Specific investigative techniques, methodologies, or operational tactics that would compromise ongoing or future investigations
- Information that would reveal the identity of confidential informants or undercover officers

This request DOES seek:
- Policies, procedures, and governance documents regarding system use
- Aggregate statistical data and anonymized audit logs showing usage patterns, search volume, and compliance
- System integration information at an architectural level (what systems connect to what) without revealing specific security vulnerabilities
- Public accountability records such as oversight reports, accuracy assessments, and policy compliance reviews

I am seeking information about the governance, oversight, financial arrangements, and operational policies surrounding these technologies—not information about specific individuals, active investigations, or sensitive law enforcement techniques. All personal identifying information of subjects, victims, witnesses, or confidential sources should be redacted as required by law.

If any responsive records contain both exempt and non-exempt information, I request that you provide the non-exempt portions with appropriate redactions, as required by Florida Statutes § 119.07(1)(d).

================================================================================

FORMAT AND FEE WAIVER REQUEST:

Please provide the requested records in their original electronic, machine-readable format. For audit reports and logs, please provide data in .csv, .xlsx, or another database format if available. For policy documents, PDF format is acceptable.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. This request is made in the public interest to promote transparency and accountability regarding the use of facial recognition technology and surveillance systems. Therefore, I request a waiver of all fees associated with this request. If any fees apply, please inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request.

================================================================================

TIME FRAME:

I prefer to receive records electronically by email attachment. Florida law requires a response to this request within a reasonable time, the timeline for this request is 10 business days. If you anticipate difficulty meeting this timeline, please contact me.

If any portion of this request is denied, please:
1. Cite the specific statutory exemption being claimed for each withheld record
2. Provide a detailed explanation of why the exemption applies to the specific information being withheld
3. Indicate whether a redacted version of the record can be provided

Thank you for your assistance. Please contact me if you have any questions about this request or require clarification on any aspect of what is being sought.

Sincerely,

Kyle Searfoss

title: Middletown CT (Middletown Town Clerk)

communications.subject: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: Middletown CT (Middletown Town Clerk)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

It is my understanding that in the past, your municipality had a school bus stop-arm camera program with American Traffic Solutions (also known as Verra Mobility or RedFlex). I would like to request a copy of the last contract in place for school bus stop arm camera enforcement with this vendor, and if applicable, any written correspondence to the vendor communicating the end or termination of the program.

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jon Smith
